text: My sister was on Oprah for her fabulous job as a Wine Angel, so we decided to celebrate over dinner at Florida Cafe.  I've always wanted to try this place however it's downtown LV and it's quite a drive from my house.  The service is excellent, the food is delicious and the ambience is family friendly. Ohh and everything at such a reasonable price.  Highly recommended!

I was really looking forward to great cuban food in a funky place. Instead what we got was a less than appetizing meal. Our server suggested a beef and a pork dish which we ordered. The meat was stringy and tough. The plantains, black beans and rice were good. The flan was excellent. Guess that one star went to the dessert. I have been here before over the course of a few years and was never disappointed. I won't be coming back.

Great food, beautiful eviroment the bakery was super fancy cakes and pastries delicious.
Food was an amazing experience best Cuban food ever.

Mi restaurant favorito en las Vegas!!!!Sin dudas la mejor comida cubana y coctelería caribeña
My favorite restaurant in VEGAS!!!without doubt the best Cuban food and Caribbean cocktails !!!!

I've been to this restaurant 5 times now - every time I visit Las Vegas.  Great food, friendly prompt service and good prices.  The only (somewhat) negative thing I can say is regarding the location.  Definitely take a cab to and from, or drive yourself.  Not a walk-to kind of place.

la comida fantastica,de los muchos restaurantes cubanos que he visitado, este es el mejor,y creo que pueden seguir creciendo si se lo proponen.
¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡felicidadez¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡¡
Best Cuban food in town. Had a great time talking with staff. Felt like one of the family. Had so much fun we went back the second night we were in town.   Go here!

Very easily the most authentic Cuban restaurant in Las Vegas...and if you want to gamble on it, in Nevada.  My Cuban family is EXTREMELY picky about Cuban food, and claim that nobody can cook as well as my grandmother - but I must confess, some of these dishes were even better than hers.  Oh hell, she thought so too!  The ropa vieja was sweet and tender, the yucca with the perfect amount of lemon juice and garlic (too many places leave them oily), and cafes con leche that are better than some places in Miami.   If you're a vegetarian, you won't really find anything to eat (the congri has pork, the vegetarian sandwich is less-than-stellar...), but meat eaters will be very happy!

It's only downfall - and for this level of flavor, it's minor,  is that Florida Cafe is located in a not so stellar location inside the HoJo's (the Howard Johnson).  

[edit: and as for Linette's comment below, I just have to say (as a fellow Cuban-American) that I disagree!  We always run into random relatives and such here, all born and raised in Cuba.)]

Kinda greasy, service was prompt but hard to hear (he was a mumbler).  Food wasn't the worst I've had but Habana, Cuba in San Jose, CA set the bar really high and this place didn't come close.  I suppose you could do worse for a hotel restaurant.

The food is great, the service is too. The new menu and the tapas makes it much better. My new favorite place. The portions are big and the prices low can't ask for more. I will be coming here mucho te often

Service has taken a significant downturn.  It was completely indifferent.  Decent food. Good music.   Horrendous service.

I am upgrading from my previous 1 star review (see above).  I went with a group of Cubans in March, and the service was much improved...very friendly.  The music was still good.  The food was much better than decent....not fabulous, but ok.

This place is awesome , not only is the food authentic but the customer service provided by the employees is outstanding . The best part is , it put the biggest smile on my Hunnys face. He said the place reminded him of back home in Miami. From the salsa music to the dessert everything is just perfect, always finish my plate and take some to go.
Price is great!! Parking is in the hotel back area, very convenient!! This place is SO GOOD! Please come to this spot! Authentic Cuban food!!!:-) wish they had this place in L.A.

Cuban Food is something that must be done right without compromise and this place ranks in my Top 5 Cuban restaurants in the nation.  Nestled in an area in between the North & South side of the strip lies some of the best mojitos in town.  Arroz con Pollo, Ropa Vieja, & Maduros are some of my classic Cuban favorites and this place has been very consistent for the last 10 years.  If you have a taste for some Amazing Cuban food and you are in Las Vegas you must eat at the Florida Cafe.

Authentic Cuban food? This place has it! I remember growing up on the 70's and there was a Cuban restaurant in NY that my parents took me to when my mom did not want to cook. It was a no different than home. That place closed down in the mid 80's and I could never find another Cuban restaurant like it. I had to travel from PA to LV to find it. You won't be disappointed. Reminds me of my childhood. And the waiter has the exact same accent my dad had.
Delicious food, great service, good music and environment, friendly staff and very reasonable prices! And the best mojitos in town!!

Can honestly say that it was the best Cuban sandwich I have eaten in a long time! And I am Cuban! Sure they where a little busy so the food took a while, and the waitress was a little slow( but she was new) but it was all worth it!   And the platanos and Chicharrónrs were amazing!  This wasn't my first time here, but it is as good as I remember it. Ps Sunday night they have like entertainment!

Picture this... Christmas Eve... a family of 6 (5 Cubans & 1 Mexican)... traditionally Noche Buena we have a very nice cuban dinner planned,,, this year, we decided to spend it in Las Vegas.  Found Florida Cafe via internet.  Called the restuarant, they indicated RESERVATIONS ARE NOT REQUIRED.  (Strike One)  We arrived at the restaurant, approx. 8:30 pm.  The restaurant was packed.  We waited for approx. 45 minutes at the bar.  Restuarant closes at 10 pm.  Within those 45 minutes, we had to wait for an unexpected large party to leave, and for the restuarant crew to clean up the tables.  As we waited patiently, had a few drinks at the bar, another large party shows up.  Remember: Reservations are not required.  The large party that showed up while we were waiting at the bar, was seated first before us.  Hmmmm!?!?!?!?!?!  (Strike Two)  Shortly thereafter, we were seated and were rushed to order our meal.  To our surprise, and it shouldn't have been, they ran out of Pierna de Puerco Asada.  (Strike Three)  We ordered Croquetas, Papas Rellenas, Ropa Vieja, Chuletas de Puerco, and Masas de Puerco.  Before we finished our meal, which now it's approx. 10:15 pm, the restaurant shuts off the music.  They started the restaurant closing practices.  Which I thought and everyone else at the table, is rude.  When we finished our meal, we asked for coffee and capuchino, and the our waitress, same as hostess, told us the coffee makers and capuchino makers were OFF!  So no coffee, nor capuchino!  OK!

Overall, our first experience, was not so great.  Food... good.  Price... ok.  Service... so-so!  Will I return to Flordia Cafe?  NO!

Will be a memorable experience... because the couple in this party, chose to come to Las Vegas and have a sort of traditional noche buena dinner for the 50th Wedding Anniversary.

I love eating lunch here!  I always get the same thing -- sandwich de ropa vieja (shredded beef, #63).  The sandwich is delicious and comes with fries.  The servings are also really substantive.  I usually only end up eating half the sandwich, and take the other half back to work.  (This is sort of dumb because I don't think the left over sandwich tastes as good.)

Although I've never had it, my peeps from work have also had the Cuban sandwich, which they really liked.  Other must orders include tostadas cubanas (toasted bread with butter -- sooooooo not healthy, but soooooooo not relevant or important when you're having some) and maduros (sweet fried plantains).  

The service is admittedly slow; the food takes times to come out and the waitress may not be back for awhile to refill your drink or for you to ask for the check.  But, as someone else pointed out, it doesn't matter because the food is damn good and makes up for it.

Also, the location looks sketch but is totally fine.  The restaurant is located inside the Howard Johnson lobby facing LV Blvd; the HoJo is a bit dilapidated.  Parking is limited either along the driveway to the back parking lot, or the back parking lot.  Once you park, you then have to walk along the driveway (short walk) to the HoJo lobby.  Easy!  

Although it was not entirely clear, last time I was there, I saw an open lot to the right of the HoJo on LV Blvd that had a Florida Cafe banner.  I think that may be a parking lot for the restaurant, but it looked like the lot was unpaved.        

Overall, the restaurant is really good and definitely worth a visit.  It's brightly decorated and has good music playing.  I especially love the ambiance.  Almost every time I've been here, I've heard Cubans speaking spanish while eating lunch near my table.  To me, that's a grade A sign of a place with good Cuban food.
The best Cuban food it's here, the attention is of first class, I recommend to try palomilla, tostones rellenos, rabo encendido,  yuca rellena,  the menu is extensive

I bought a coupon for $25 off at Florida Cafe from restaurant.com.  The coupon clearly states that it does not expire.  The coupon required a $35 purchase so my husband and I ordered a lot more than we normally would have.  When it came time to pay, the manager refused to honor the coupon because he said he had a dispute with restaurant.com.  No apology, no offer to take anything off the bill, nothing.  How shortsighted!  I will never go back there because of this.  Good job, manager of Florida Cafe - you lost a Vegas local as a possible repeat customer, but saved yourself $25.
Stopped in at a nearby motel and saw the place on yelp. Glad we gave it a try. Great food, good service, awesome mojitos. Going to hit up that bakery in the morning before we get out of here.

this review will be a bit all over the place because of our experience...

i've had a $10 restaurant.com coupon for almost a year and finally made it there.  i was looking forward to their buffet so i could try a variety of Cuban dishes.  i've never had Cuban food before.  they said they wouldn't take the restaurant.com coupon!  server said they only take Groupon coupons for the buffet, BUT they stopped the buffet two weeks prior!  the server walked away with our drink order, we were baffled, so i check their website on my phone and it advertises a buffet!  i called restaurant.com and easily got the certificate refunded.

my friend (female latina) read them the riot act and asked to speak to the manager.  they said the manager had just left to go shopping.  they eventually called the owner who said they are in a lawsuit with restaurant.com, but they would honor $10 discount.  now on to the regularly scheduled review.

the menu is HUGE!  almost 150 items!!!  no, i didn't count them; thankfully they have everything numbered!  i ordered the Sandwich Cubano ($7.99) which came with a small bowl of fries and my friend got the Pollo a la Pancha ($12.95) that came with some very dark rice and beans.  they served warm (fresh?) bread that was pretty good.  once it finally came, my sandwich was awesome!  i was a little worried about the combo of pulled park, sliced ham, cheese, dill pickles, and mustard but my mouth was in heaven!  the pressed Cuban bread was pretty tasty, too.  The pollo was, um, bland.  i thin, smallish breast that had little taste.  the rice was a little salty but pretty tasty.

so, there customer service is good, waitstaff is fairly attentive and my sandwich rocked!  their advertising and speed of service needs some work.  i also enjoyed the Cuban music they played, although it was a bit loud for lunchtime.

PS:  the buffet is still advertised on their website.  :(

The only reason I am giving this restaurant 4 stars is strictly for the food. Being from Miami, I love Cuban food and I haven't had it in a long time. The food is amazing; so much that I went there for dinner the first night and breakfast the following two mornings. If there was a rating for service I would give it a 1. The first night we arrived at around 9:20 pm (they close at 10 pm). We got our appetizers, but still had not gotten utensils or napkins. We had to ask for water twice, once when we got there and once when the appetizers arrived. Note we were the only ones in there. For breakfast the next two days, the service got worse. On the third day we waited for 15 minutes after being seated until we ordered. Our waitress seemed to avoid us every time I tried to make eye contact.  Make sure you ask for water when you get there cause we waited about 20 minutes to get water.  Our food and coffee arrived first than our water; how do you explain that?  Bottom line, this was the worst service I have ever received, but for me alone the food was worth the lack of sevice. Unfortunately, I would definitely go again.

Spectacular Cuban place in Vegas with a Caribbean decor, authentic Cuban food specially "Palomilla and Ropa Vieja," uhmmm delicious. The owner is a typical cuban very frienly, and the Manager and Bartender who's name is Erich i guess is a very professional guy. i had an unforgettable experience in this amazing restaurant ending my night dancing latin music in the night club placed right at the back area. I'll find the way to be back soon.

My goodness the food is soooo good here. My girlfriend and I where at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and he was on top of his job even though the restaurant was having a busy Saturday night with a full party going on in the back the drink orders never stopped but he made us feel very comfortable anyway. Then when the food came out it was cooked to perfection. I can't wait to go back I have been thinking about my next plate of Cuban food all week!!!!

The food is AMAZING but the service is absolutely HORRIBLE.  The waitress is not very nice and is always in a rush. Do not eat there on your lunch break because you will be late going back to work. My husband went for lunch and ended up walking out because they were taking too long. People who came after him were getting their food 1st. When he was walking out the waitress said his food was on the way out and he said he had been waiting a long time and had to leave she then asked him to pay!!! He just left.  One time when I went there I was still ordering and she was walking away! I don't understand how that lady is still employed there.. she is always there during the day so maybe when she's gone it gets better...

Decent pastries and café. My problem with this place is the ridiculously slow service. I walked in to pick up some pastries and no one was at the counter. It took about 5 minutes for someone to offer help even though the staff saw us walk in. I looked around saw only 3 tables with patrons with 4-5 restaurant staff. When we were done and ready to pay it took 15 minutes to have someone bring us the check. After it was brought to us no one picked it up and I walked it up to the lady at the register who redirected me back to my seat and told to wait for my server. The server did not return to the table for about 20 minutes. With this being said I doubt I will return as slow service and mediocre food is not enough to prompt a return.

I would come here all the time when I lived in Las Vegas. Came from Arizona to eat here today and the service was so slow and horrible. Sat at my table for 10 min before anyone came to me. I had to finally flag someone down. They also used to give out bread before the meal. Nothing. Truly disappointed in the service today. $15 Lyft ride for this.... not good

I visited the all-you can eat buffet Cuban adjacent to the restaurant.  I believe it doubles as a lounge after hour. (The stage, dj booth and large speaker are a dead give away.)  

The location is kind of out of the way.  Their sister restaurant (Havana Grill) is much more convenient.  The restaurant is located in the Howard Johnson Motel in the sketchy stretch of Las Vegas Boulevard that no one ever talks about (north of the Stratosphere).  I only went  because I had a Groupon. 

The Good:  the arroz con pollo and tres leches cakes (chocolate and traditional) are very good.  The staff was friendly.

The Bad: pretty much everything else.  Be careful when grabbing the serving spoons, some were hot enough to burn and some were cold just like the food in the trey.  So a lot of the meat was dry from sitting at too hot of a temperature or was cold because it was not held at proper temp.

I doubt I'll be back even if there were another  Groupon, unless I have an insatiable urge for tres leches cake.

¡Óyeme viejo!  So far, this is the best Cuban cafe here in Vegas.  Everywhere I travel, I need my Cuban fix, and this place is it.  

Easy to find, it's located inside a Howard Johnson motel. Nothing fancy here folks,  just darn good breakfast. All the girls who are serving are very kind.  You have to start with a Cafe con Leche. Which they bring with toasty French bread.  Mmmm.  Or you can go to the Cuban bakery just opened steps away and order una empanada de guayaba.  A guava filled pastry.  Oh my!   I ordered the Cubano breakfast with a side of yucca al mojo con chicharrones. Delish!   Awesome Latin music playing in background, the smells emitting from the kitchen, the sound of the milk being frothed for your café and watching the servers walking back and forth just contributes to the enjoyment.   Ask for Malbys as your server.  She's very nice. 

Please, if you're expecting a foo foo place, don't show up.  But if you're down to earth, this is the place for you to get your fix.  And they have clean restrooms!  At least during day.  Oh, and at night, they have music and dancing.  Come on over y relájate.

This place is awesome about 5-8 yrs ago....suddenly the service and food quality have gone down. The masa de puerco used to come in a garlic sauce, now your lucky if you get any sauce. Need to find another Cuban reataurant.

Florida cafe has been around for more than 17yrs I must say so far is the best Cuban Restaurant in Las Vegas!!! I still remember coming as a little girl with my mom. The food reminded us of my grandma's cooking. I highly recommend it if you are looking for authentic Cuban food this is the place to be..oh and they do have the BEST Mojitos ever and the flan is exquisite!!! :)

This ex-Floridian loves this place! The food is authentic and reminds me of warm, breezy nights on the water in South Florida. All of my favorites, just like I remember: papas rellenas, ropa vieja, picadillo, and roast pork are well-prepared and delicious! And I always have a mojito, also fabulous. The only thing I miss that they don't serve is yellow rice---I make do with white rice (and it's not enough of a minus to subtract a star because everything else is so good). The atmosphere is great, too, with non-stop, upbeat tropical music. We're regulars here now and highly recommend it!

Amazing !!!
Great service
Mojitos were wonderful
Definitely will be back!

Worst cuban restaurant. Period.

ENVIRONMENT: place was dark and had cheap, plastic decorations everywhere... Which i dont get since the place turns into a night club at night.

SERVICE: we were the ONLY customers there... Yet we still waited an hour for our food to come. The server's excuse was that they "had a new cook" ya ya.. Not to mention one out of only two employees was by the restroom using her phone their whole time.

QUALITY/PRICE: high priced crap food. Yup. I said it. All the meat and fish we ordered were extremely dry and bland. No flavor. Paid $18 for a 4x4 piece of chicken and a small cup of rice and beans. Disgusting. 

I DONT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

Deliciosa la comida , un lugar elegante. Lo malo es el servicio la mala atención al cliente mi familia y yo esperamos cómo 20 minutos para que nos tomarán la orden y ni siquiera refill de agua nos dieron

As I sit here at the restaurant, I am disappointed to say that the quality has gone down. We go to Florida cafe everytime we visit Vegas, Usually 2-3 times a year.   The Cuban sandwich and bistec sandwich are good. Very disappointed in the pollo a la plancha. The chicken was dry wasn't as flavorful as it used to be. Service was terrible. It took 15-20 minutes just to get our drinks ordered. Getting a refill was also a pain. She checked on us once, after our drinks mand that was the last time we saw our waitress until about 20 minutes later when I got up and walked to the bar to ask or more sprite and Pepsi.  The place wasn't vey busy. Our waitress began cleaning tables before checking in how we were doing. We used to look forward to eating at this establishment when we go to Vegas. Not sure of that's gonna happen any more. Not sure if their was a change in ownership or what the reason was.

Celebrated an awesome Mother's Day lunch with my Mom and Sister -- Cuban-Style!  I had the arroz con pollo and it was better than perfect.  The wait staff was amazing to say the least.  We had a waiter and waitress who tended to us in Spanish and made sure we we would enjoy our celebration lunch.  We even got a free photo postcard taken and created to mark the special occasion.

Their food is ok. Nothing out of this world, but for whatever they have in food it is not worth it for the service. Some of the worst service I have ever seen. Didn't check on us. We asked for the check and it took them 25 min (we timed) to run our card. Absolute waste of time.

From Diana & Joel in Los Angeles

My wife and I love Cuban food.  In our hometown of Los Angeles we go regularly to Versailles on the westside.  You can imagine our delight when we came to Las Vegas and discovered the Florida Cafe on Las Vegas Blvd south inside the Howard Johnson Motel.

The owner, Sergio and his wife,  are the most gracious hosts you could find anywhere.  We love the food so much at the Florida Cafe, we have come back through the years and we have eaten there  many times.  We visit  Las Vegas every year and our first stop is always this wonderful restaurant.

Through the years, Sergio has not just maintained but upgraded the beautiful decor--including conga drums for bar stools in front of a well-stocked bar, and the quality of the wonderful food.

Our favorite breakfast is Desayuno Cubano #5 for $8.95:  two eggs any style, two mashed potato balls stuffed with picadillo, sweet plantains and Cuban toast.  For a small additional fee, we usually get
rice and their wonderful black beans.  

Also recently we discovered their ham croquetas which are to die for.

All their delicious foods, their decor, the Cuban music playing softly in the background, all transport you back to Old Havana.   

For locals, this should be a a regular stop; for tourists to Las Vegas, it's a wonderful alternative to the noisy strip where you can enjoy great food at reasonable prices with attentive service.

If you have a car, try Sergio's  newer place in Henderson, Havanna Grill with live music and dancing  on the weekends .

My husband and I come here every time we go to Vegas.  The service is wonderful!  And the food... well I'll just say this much,  it's Cuban food that your mom ( in this case) mother in law makes at home.  We recently went with a party of 13 and every single thing we ordered was outstanding.  All this restaurant is missing is a dance floor

Yesterday. I went. To the Florida cafe for lunch. The service. Was terrible. The. Food was even. Worse. I returned. The. Food because. It was cold we did not get any bread till we where. Finished. And it was lke a rock the drinks. Can a half hor later. And the food came about 2 hours later our waitrirs short chunkie has a terrible. Attitude. I will never eat there in tha crapy. Place again. Or i recommend. That nobody eats  there. Ever Ana Reina 909-667-6537

This restaurant was one of our go to Cuban restaurants when we were in Vegas.  We had been many times and were always satisfied with the food and service.  NO LONGER!  We will not be back.  We went with a large group for dinner.  The waitress was pushing appetizers on us and seems very eager to have us order a lot.  After we ordered, the waitress disappeared.  We had to track down the waitress just to find out about what happened to our food, because it was taking so long.  When the food finally came, the waitress mixed up some of the food plates and the food was tasteless.  Would not recommend this place.

Fun atmosphere, cheap breakfasts (!) And GREAT cuban sandwiches!!
They are big though! Maybe consider sharing with a friend!
Try the ham croquette sandwich :)

Food was fantastic!  Ropa Vieja was excellent as was the Moros y cristianos. 

Service left a lot to be desired hence the 3 star. I blame management. We were being served by the bartender, who also had a table of 14!  Staff more or seat less!  Still nice server despite...

I am going to rate this place high for the Cubano sandwich, which was packed with good pork and ham . . . but especially for the Espresso, best I've had since my trip to Havana in '97. And at $2 a demi-cup, well I had three . . .  great fuel for a late night on the town. My partner recommends the black bean soup and the avocado salad , which was a beautiful presentation of one dead ripe Forida avocado (the big ones) sliced, face down on the half shell, perfectly peeled with a lemon garnish.  Excellent.  The service, however, was crap . . .  I had to go to the bar to find my waiter who was engaged in conversation with two other gentlemen . . . in other words, the Espresso was as good as Havana and the service was on par with what the State provides on the Island.
Very inviting u feel welcomed right away. The food. Is to die for excellant.  Must come n try.

So, we got some croquetas, chicharrones, and some ropa vieja. The chicharrones seemed like the kind you get from a bag. Very disappointing. The croquetas were okay. The ropa vieja was average. The best thing was the rice ans beans that came with the plate. I would not recommend this restaurant to a friend. I won't waste my money at this place again.

Fucking A!!! This was the best food we had in Vegas and we had some exclusive- celebrity chef kind of food and it's nowhere even close. The service is top notch and the food is authentic. We ordered 8 dishes and all of them were great tasting. This is the place if you like Cuban food.

We had a great experience at this Cuban jewel!!! Food was great, and Service was exceptional! Our waiter was very attentive and the manager even gave us a free appetizer! Background music was spot on and made us feel so welcomed and relaxed. We can't wait to come back to celebrate our anniversary! Cuban sandwich was great, my cafe con leche y tostada delicious and even our kids were amazed by the place and delicious food! It is a must if you come to Vegas!!!
Food was amazing. Service was on point. I recommend this place to anyone looking for Cuban food in Las Vegas.
Magnifico bistec de palomilla. El Karaoke del Domingo a las 7PM esta muy bueno--con Julio "El Cesar del Karaoke." Lo van a repetir todos los Domingos de 7 a 11PM.

This is a great family restaurant. We have been coming here since we discovered it many years ago. The food is authentic delicious Cuban cuisine. Nothing fancy but very good. They have both American and Cuban choices so for any Cuban American like us, it's the best. On our recent sisters/mother road trip we came in the morning. They were not open but welcomed us with warmth and Cuban humor.  We enjoyed our cafe con leche, maduros, papas rellenas and ordered croquetas since our grandmother was famous for hers. They were just as good. We recommend it
to all our friends who visit Las Vegas. It's only a short distance from the strip but worth the trip.

The bread is really tasty, the Cuban sandwiches are very tasty and pretty filling. The pulled pork at our table was a little dry, and my sandwich didn't come with pickles, I had to request them. They were out of maduros and the black beans were too soupy and a little blandishments. Seems pretty authentic. No substitute for the fries, which isn't good for me! Nasty Taters precious!

My girlfriend took me here for my first official Cuban meal.  I've had similar Latin cuisine, but this was my first truly Cuban restaurant.  We started with the espresso. Don't let the tiny cup and baby spoon fool you, this coffee packs a big punch.  Very strong yet smooth and not bitter.  We decided in tapas and forgive me for not remembering the names of the dishes, but my descriptions should suffice.  First was chorizo with garlic and onions coverered in melted  cheese and seven with sliced buttered bread.  Immediately I fantasized about taking down this dish after a night of binge drinking.  The bread sopped up all the grease and oily goodness.  Second we had fried plantain cups filled with shrimp and topped with more cheese.  This dish which contains three of my favorite foods all in one is hands down my new favorite.  

Other than the great food, atmosphere was nice, and the small staff was friendly and personable.  Will come back again.
The service was very slow, it took over 30 min for a steak sandwich and the plantains were a joke.  I wouldn't eat there if they gave it to me for free.

We had the waitress with the dark hair she had an attitude and didn't do her job. The blonde waitress had to finally bring us a part of our order she never checked with us an disappeared for over 30 mins at a time. The food was cold when it finally came out and the table next to us got up and left. 

This place is horrible! I don't know how it's still in business!

Food is not bad and the staff means well, but service can be slow at times and a language barrier is occasionally in play. And this is now inside a FORMER Howard Johnson motel...now called Hotel Shalimar.

Though I sooo don't look it, I actually am half Cuban...and I loves me some Cuban food!  Hard to get where I live unfortunately, so when I travel, I usually try to do a search to see if any can be had in my destination city.  Did I do it before my recent last minute trip to Vegas?? Uhhh, NO!  But luckily, the sister stumbled across this little gem in the back of a magazine...yay for us!

I was dubious about this place due to its location.  I mean really, how good could it be?  It was part of a crusty old Howard Johnson's in a rather run down (dare I say skanky?) part of town...not exactly inspiring!  But, for me,  the lure of platano maduro cannot, nay, WILL NOT be denied, so off to Florida Cafe we went!

The restaurant was cute enough inside, with a nice tropical feel - perhaps a bit tired but had a relaxed, easy going vibe.  Our waitress was gracious, accomodating and the service was fairly prompt.  No complaints.

We started off with the ensalada de aguacate. A large portion of avocado and a nice presentation...it was served dry and I missed the ubiquitous yummy garlicky dressing that I've come to expect.  We made due with the oil and vinegar available but it just wasn't the same. Still tasty though.

For our entrees, we both opted for the black beans and rice and of course, my all time fav, platano maduro!!   First off, the beans were cooked perfectly...dark, rich and flavorful.  Deeelish!   As for the platano, I was in sweet ripe fried plantain heaven!!  They were uberyummy...soft, sweet, dark, dark brown (almost looked burnt, but trust me, that's a good thing!!) and had chewy, carmelized edges.  God, I live for those crusty edges!!!!  Yea, I'm weird that way!

Oh and the bread was yummy too!

So, is this the best Cuban food I've ever had?  No, that is reserved for Versailles in Miami and, to a lesser degree,  La Cubana in Glendale.  But it was really good...reasonable, tasty and very satisfying.  And though I cannot vouch for any of their other offerings, I was more than pleased with the experience and am looking forward to my next visit to Vegas and Florida Cafe!

And yes, I did take 2 additional orders of platano maduro home with me!!!  God I love that shit!

I went today to Florida Cafe for my birthday what a disappointment I order Ropa Vieja and my fiance order some appetizer the food was cold for Cuban restaurant in Las Vegas is a really disappointment since we don't have too many Cuban restaurants in this area., not only did the food was horrible the service was very poor and not too professional I would not recommend this place to know one.. oh yeah $3 for soda really!

We went here around the holidays last year. I am very familiar with Cuban food and this place is mediocre, to put it kindly. They would not survive in Miami. Visit there and you'll see. 

For starters, they use low quality ingredients yet charge full price. The steak that we ordered did not even have grill marks and the fillet was very skinny. One could find a similar quality steak in a Mexican restaurant for 1/4 to 1/3 off and they'll stuff you with fixings (e.g. chips and salsa), which compensates. 

I ordered a salad and all of the greens were iceberg lettuce and it was very pale, almost white. They could have thrown in a few pieces of romaine, butter and/or green leaf lettuce(s) to add some life and color. I'm not asking for escarole or French leafy greens. Even buffets do better for less. What I paid for was mainly the meat in my salad. That's so disappointing because even my homemade salads are better than this. 

Though I don't eat bread, my relative told me that it tasted okay, but she's had better. She had to ask for real butter because they gave her margarine. The waitress stated that it was butter, but my relative explained the difference between margarine and butter in Spanish. That's when she got the point. The meat and accompanying sauce was very flavorful. That's why I didn't give them 1 star. 

I get the sense that they nickel and dime everything because they're on Las Vegas Blvd. Technically, the Strip has not yet begun in this location because it is still considered a part of Downtown. This only means that the badlands are only a few blocks away. If drive around at night, you'll see what I mean. Location is everything.

The service was okay, but the waitress tried to overcharge us (not a lot of money); so not cool.
Food is not bad. However if you are planning on taking your partner for San Valentine arrive to the restaurant around Jan 2 because the service is extremely slow every single time.

I have been here twice before, mostly because of my love of cuban food.  It has been better before but never great.  I liked the maduros, but that was about it.  

I ordered an amazon.local gift deal (like groupon) where you get $20 of food for $10. Showed it to the the waitress before eating and then we ordered.  We ordered more than usual, because of the $20 voucher.  

When it was time to pay, I told her to make sure she took the $20 off.  She didn't take it off, ran my credit card for the full amount and said that because the manager wasn't there I couldn't use it!!!! WHAT?????  She told me to come eat there another time and use it and maybe the manager would be there.  

I politely said, "Couldn't you call the manager or amazon.com?"  She said, "Not really..."  She also said she couldn't refund any of the money because she already ran my credit card.  What a scam. 

I was angry, and will never be back again.  So much for a repeat customer.  I will advise anyone never to go.  Worst service ever. And the food wasn't even good.

This review is for the Bar ONLY. We didn't eat.

This place makes me laugh a litle....decor that is, and the interesting characters we saw inside. Nothing WRONG with it, just kind of made me giggle and smile. Tehehehe.

We were attending a very fabulous, formal fancy shotgun wedding at the Little Chapel next door. We were early, the Chapel was running late. Shotgun weddings and booze go hand in hand so we stopped in at the HOJO and saw this Cafe. Perfect. It has a bar. 

The bartender was friendly and made us some wonderful drinks! Granted, they were only Captain 'n Cokes but hey, they were some MEAN Captain 'n Cokes and hit the spot. I thought maybe since it was inside the HOJO and close to downtown that the drinks would be cheap. Wrong. Try $7 each. Damn, steep for "nearly downtown" but I guess it's technically ON the strip...

If I'm ever in the area and need a quick drink I will definately stop in. Maybe even try some food next time.

This is our new go to Cuban restaurant. We arrived around 930 pm , Saturday night, and The Fourth of July, about 1/2 an hour before closing. Plenty of parking in the back. Friendly staff. Efficient service from Micheal. Clean dining room. Our food was very good. Would like to have sampled the bread, but we heard from our waiter that the chef had already cleaned up bread because he didn't think anyone else was coming in. That was sad. Had the tostones with shrimp and manchengo cheese as an appetizer, and they were delicious. For entrees,  I had the roast pork ( pernil ) with sautéed onions. Very tasty. It was accompanied by black beans and white rice on the plate, and they were both excellent! My husband  had the Ropa Vieja ( beef )and he loved it.  We were too full to try any dessert, but we will definitely be back again, and will make a point of saving room for some flan or tres leches cake, and a cafe con leche.

So I decided on a whim that I would try this place out for lunch after reviewing previous Yelpers reviews. After all...my palate, I trust!  So I drove to the Howard Johnsons and navigated the extremely narrow driveway to park in the rear.  I then sauntered into the restaurant where I was promptly and warmly greeted by a man I shall refer to as "Julio."  

Julio promptly seated me and then asked me the cursory restaurant questions and I asked that he tell me what was good for lunch.  Julio said "everything."  He then asked me about an appetizer and in typical Cuban fashion he spoke so friggin fast that all I caught was fried...potato...and beef!  So I said, "sure."

He brought the appetizer out so fast I thought he may have pulled it off another table.  It was surprisingly very good and tasty.  I'd love to tell you the proper name but again, all I heard was "fried...potato...and beef!"

The waitress came and I ordered a chicken breast marinated in citrus and garlic covered with grilled onions.  She also spoke very fast and with an accent so thick that apparently I ordered an avocado salad as well.

The food came out rather quickly and the avocado salad turned out to be a fully sliced and pitted avocado and a very small plate of greens.  The marinated chicken breast was covered with grilled onions and served with white rice and black beans.  Needless to say, the food, although not what I had expected, was actually quite delicious.

The decor was very Caribbean themed as was the music.  In a nutshell, I'd promptly go back there again just to try something else off the menu.

Very disappointed. We went with a large party for dinner. There was also another large party around the same time. The service was extremely slow. It took over 1-1/2 hours for the food to be served. When they finally served the plates a bad smell was coming from my plate. I smelled the pork dish only to find that the pork was spoiled. About 6 dishes were sent back. This is a place I would never go back to.

I visited the restaurant because my wife insisted that it was awesome... and guess what...it was!!!!!!!!! his goes to show you canot always go by reviews!!!!! The service was excellent, the guy came by, was very cordial, checked on us more than once, food was hot and tasty, and this was after I walked half a mile to ge there!!!! No complaints, please, go try it for yourself before you believe the reviews...shame on you negative reviewers!!!!!!!
I love Florida Cafe! I come here every couple of weeks and they always remember me. The staff is so great and the Cuban sandwich with plantain chips are delicious!

I have been coming here since I was little and still continue to come for the food!! The food is delicious but the services SUCKS. No one listens and they act like we are bothering them when we are asking simple things. I wish I could give a better review because I absolutely love the food but they should really think about getting people that can at least act like they care about there customers.

First of all, the service was not very welcoming.  I was Saturday afternoon Solo dining, and sat at the bar for a mojito and a Cuban sandwich.  Which I never ordered because the waitress/bartender/hostess never even inquired if I wanted a menu.  Mojito was average, too much lime, and it was stirred, not shaken.  No love put in there!    Had a Heineken next and then left.  Staff feels like they are bored and don't like their jobs very much.  Or each other.  Like robots really.  The bartender/waitress/hostess was definitely busting her ass way harder than anyone else.  I would give it another try, maybe on a busy night when dinner service is in full swing, to try the food and check out the ambience.
I looked forward to eating here but, unfortunately I won't be back, the bread which was so good had changed actually made me nauseous. The soup recipe also changed to bad.

Used a groupon on this place and they put additional charges on our meal- including a required tip on a buffet where you grab your own food. The food was stale, there were no vegetarian options, and no salsa!!! The worst meal I have had in las Vegas to date. So not worth the money!!! Do not eat there!!!

The service was extremely slow. The waitress walked by us many times without asking us if we were ready. We probably waited 30 minutes by the time we had to hunt her down...ridiculous! Then, to make it worse the food was terrible. I had some dish that said succulent pork leg. I don't know if this is the way how it should be cooked, but the pork pieces where so hard like beef jerky and it was far from "succulent." I didn't care for that. Also the portion was extremely tiny. I didn't care for the dark rice and the plantation appetizer had no seasoning whatsoever on it. When the waitress did interact with us, she was very friendly. Too little, too late though.
Service friendly, Cuban food authentic, but not prepared to it's full potential. I'm sure they have some very cool parties going on. But for my lunch was just very average.

The service here isn't the greatest but the food more than makes up for it!

My husband loves the house-made pork rinds but my favorite will always be the Ropa Vieja until I can figure out how to make a similar one at home. The meat is tender and flavorful and their rice is good, too.

He has also tried and loved the Cubano sandwich and my daughter is a big fan of the Fricase de Pollo con Pappas. 

And I don't know how, exactly, they make their mojitos but I have always hated mojitos until I tried theirs. So very tasty and refreshing on a hot summer day!

The service here is on the slow side but if you don't have anywhere to be, why rush it?

The sandwiches were excellent; everything else, not so much. Meats that were dry and tasteless outside two slices of bread were tender and satisfying between them. My Cubano was well-constructed and well-seasoned, though the accompanying fries were just OK. Nevertheless, the sandwiches make this a solid cheap-by-Vegas-standards option that doesn't require you to get off Las Vegas Blvd. Don't get married here though.
Excellent breakfast "El Cubano" cafe Cuban style the best! Will go back when I return to Vegas! Aloha

Came here for the first time and I will definitely be back for more Cuban food everything that I ordered was delicious it remind me of my grandma's home cooking from the appetizers that we ordered to the main dish. 

Vine aquí por primera vez y sin duda voy a volveré para más comida cubana. Todo lo que pedí fue delicioso, me recuerda much a la cocina de mi abuela.

I'm going to keep this short & sweet. The service was awful. We waited to be seated as staff walked passed, when finally someone called out to go ahead and seat ourselves. OK fine. Drinks took forever & were watered down. The food was bland to say the least. We thought the whole experience was a joke. At some point a beggar dude started walking through the restaurant asking for money. Like I said we thought it was the never ending joke and every time we're looking for a new restaurant before hitting up a Smith's Center show, we laugh about the awful experience at the Howard Johnson's Florida Cafe. It really looks like a place for local hookers & dealers not serious people out to enjoy a nice dinner.

I purchased a Groupon deal for their buffet - buy one get one free.  The fine print says that the buffet was from Friday to Sunday.  However when we got there, the server said the buffet was changed to just Saturday and Sunday.  They were flexible enough to still let us use our Groupon, which I was very pleased with.  My husband and I both ordered the Pollo Frito - marinated chicken then fried.  It comes with beans and rice.  The chicken was very good and juicy.  I also had a side of sweet plantains, which is the highlight of our whole meal.

The food is good, but wow, that service was awful. It took 3 separate requests to get drinks right, and even then we never got sugar for our tea, we ended up grabbing one off a tray at another table. Absolutely no one got what they ordered. Steak sandwiches instead of chicken, entree chicken salads instead of avocado side salads, fighting with us about whether or not this plain steak was breaded, we actually had to point out this plain steak was not the same as someone's breaded steak 2 plates over before they finally brought out a breaded steak, telling us mistakes like the salad were on the house then calling us liars when the bill came. I never got what I ordered. It was good whatever it was, but it was not citrus marinated flank steak.

I came here once recently with a large party (~25 or so people).  The food was generally very good, but the service not so much.  I'm presuming the reason was the sheer size of our group coupled with being under staffed that night, but the experience was still rather bad.  We arrived around 6pm and it was well after 9pm before we finally had our check paid.  Some of our group couldn't wait and asked to have their portion of the check split out (which they did), but this caused an unknown problem later when the rest of us needed to pay our bills, causing nearly an hour delay after we had all finished our meals and drinks.  There was also a longer than normal wait to get our food.

I had not had "authentic" Cuban food before this visit and I was pleasantly surprised.  I thought my meal was really good which was a bit of a saving grace helping to make up for the rest of the dining experience.  I would return in a small group or with just my family, but I would not recommend coming here with a large group.
The best Cuban restaurant I've attended outside of New York and Miami. Great fun, great food. Nuf said.

The servers were super nice and fast. However... the food was surprisingly bland. No citrus or spices on the steak or pork or yucca and the fried plantains were not sweet almost under ripe. Drinks were delicious! (Sangria, mojito and the pina colada.)

This is a bit expensive, but nice and friendly spot with very nice service for Cuban food on LVBLVD (just south of Charleston). Okay, let's dig in to my short review:

Can I compare their Cortadito (or the Cafe Con Leche) to one served street-side out of a styrofoam cup in an isolated Miami-based Cuban neighborhood where you'd swear they imported the high-octane bean directly from Cuba? No. Not even close. But their Pan Con Tortilla was pretty damned amazing. 

Would I come back? Possibly. But the Florida Cafe (to me) served more as a tourist interpretation of a Cuban restaurant, rather than one carved out of an authentic Cuban suburb.

I LOVED THIS PLACE....Ok not the best location or fastest service BUT Im not a snob and i know how to enjoy eating out!!!!! 
The BAD: Im guessing the Buffet I HATE BUFFETS ANYWAY GROSS!!!!
The GOOD: We used a Groupon and had lunch at 2:00 HAPPY HOUR 2 for 1 beer YA
More GOOD: The food that I had was Sooooo Gooooood and I looked at other peoples plates too (Thats the way I roll) haha And everyone's food looked really good!!!!!!!
The Atmosph is pretty cool and the place was clean..

This isn't as good as their Henderson location.  Sorry guys.  Parking is a nightmare.  You have to park around the back of the hotel.  But that is not the reason that it is not as good.  The best way to describe it is that the food lacked passion.
Pretty happy with my oxtail meal.  White rice so good. Been here at least 6 times.  I enjoy dining something different in Las Vegas and this is the spot for me and my mom

We came here on our honneymoon exactly one year ago, the place was heaven.  We came back for our anniversary, and everything was horrid.  The service sucked.  The food was bland and had no flavor.  We had Arroz con Pollo and Picadillo, two of the most famous cuban dinners, and they were nasty and had no flavor.  All that was used was nasty dark meat chicken.  I will not be back and will instead be getting my Cuban food cuisine at the place down the street, Rincon Criollo.

This will be the first Cuban restaurant that I have ever been. I checked the Cuban menu out and I decided to tast the covered breaded steak with onions on top (because I'm just getting started with the caramelized onions) and they were the greatest dish. Oh but I also not to forget the white rice and the beans on the side which was the best thing on the dish. This dish was the best thing I have ever tasted. My first visit to this restaurant was on July 11, 2013. Also my niece went to sing songs on the karaoke which was also the thing to wait for the food to come. As as I said this was the first cuban restaurant that I have been in my life.

I was recently in Vegas visiting family and had heard about how good this restaurant was so we decided to try it.  It was very disappointing.  Mojitos were weak, service was painfully slow.  The waiter was almost nonexistent and did not even bother to come back and see how the food was.  The churrasco we ordered was definitely not churrasco, but sandwich steak.  The fries ordered were last to come out, at least ten minutes after the meal.  I would definitely not go there again.
Buen servicio y comida exquisita, buen ambiente un lugar maravilloso que nos hace recordar nuestra Bella Cuba, buena musica la pasamos maravillosamente mi Esposo y yo
The food and service was excellent. They even had Latin music playing. I will definitely return to this restaurant on my next trip to Vegas.

Been here several times over the years and although the food is delicious,  the service sucks. Won't be coming back again, because the service this last time was so bad. We waited 25 mins without one acknowledgment, finally he takes our drink order, didn't get any better from there. My advice,  go to Havana grill, same food, same owner, better service.

I have been going to the Florida Cafe for about ten years and I absolutely love the food! It is always a must on any Vegas visit.  The food is authentic (I am Cuban), very flavorful and you can't beat the price.  I have found the service to be very good and friendly, perhaps some of the complaints below have to do more wiht cultural differences than poor customer service.  If you can engage the staff and especially the owner in conversation, you will never leave and keep have "cafecitos"!   I highly recommend this restaurant....the plates on the walls (not plastic!!!!!)  are done by Wilson Posada,a local Cuban artist, I was lucky enough to meet him there yesterday and bought some of his pieces which I now proudly display in my home.  Gracias Anacleto for such a wonderful experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Shoutout to Florida Cafe with their bomb cafe con leche. The rambiquiquiquimiqui is delicious or however you spell it. Mojitos poppn. Empanadas, poppin. WHO MADE MY EMPANADAS? I WANT YALL TO MAKE IT EVERY TIME

Does anyone work here????
Tried this place twice , and both times we received little to no service . Food ok! But nothing to brag about.

Best coffee in town, and the bakery, wow! Fresh and so nicely displayed, definitely coming back to try the dinner.

Back again for more amazing food, coffee, and dessert.

Danierys was wonderful, always smiling and making sure we are well taken care of, thank you!

THE SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE !!! If I could give this place no stars I would . I went to the Florida Cafe just to pick up some pastelitos . The hostess at the bakery was rude and refused to assist us by helping another Hispanic customer (we were there before her )and then just walking away . She told her coworker " someone else will help them because I'm not doing it ". Me being African American felt very mistreated . It was not okay . I will never go back there ever again !!!!!!

There were four of us and the best thing about this place was the bread that doesn't get refilled. Don't come here.  It smells funny and the service is horrible!  I have heard good things but this is like being in the twilight zone!

We sent a scouting party, my adult son and I, to check it out on Sunday, February 19, 2017, to make sure there would be seating for a group of 6-10, check out the area since it's in a shady part of town, and to check out the parking.

On Sunday evening, about 6:30pm, my adult son and I parked behind the restaurant, and proceeded through the hotel lobby to the dining room.  There were about 20+ people in the restaurant/bar drinking and eating.  Our order was taken by a gentleman and then served by a waitress.  We ordered masitas de puerco ($8), Cuban sandwich ($10), moros y cristanos ($5), yuca mojo con chicharo ($8), an expresso ($3) and a fountain soda ($3) (and a flan de carmello, that was never served).  The food was served fairly quickly.  We tried several times to get refills on the soda and expresso.  We sat there for at least 45 minutes just waiting for a drink refill and the check.  They finally offered to bring the check, and offered to send the flan to go because it was already on the check.  We said, "No, we wanted it with our meal, just take it off."  I don't like carrying wet food in my car.  They brought the check, we paid and left.  

On Saturday afternoon, about 1:00pm, our club members showed for lunch.  There were seven of us total.  We were the only ones in the restaurant to eat at that time.  We were seated together and we asked about separate checks.  We were told they could only do three separate checks.  We said fine, and placed four people on one check, two on another check, and one person on a check alone.  We wanted to try a variety of the Cuban foods, so on the check for four, we ordered two chicharon ($10), croquetas ($6), mezcla de aperitivos ($15), empanadas de ham ($6), two Cuban sandwiches ($20), moros y cristanos ($5), yuca mojo con chicharo ($6), flan de carmello (but it was never served), and for drinks we ordered te caliente ($3), Caribbean drink ($3), and a batidos ($6).  The other two tickets had a couple dishes and drinks, including a cranberry drink that also was never served.  During the food service, we asked if they could turn down the music because we couldn't chat over it, it was fairly loud.  The music was never turned down, so we just shouted across the table at each other.  Every food item was brought out and placed in front of the wrong persons.  We traded it around until we got it right.  The cranberry juice and flan was never served.  Once the majority of the food was delivered, we did not see the waitress or older lady again until we were very ready to leave.  They never checked back to see if we needed anything else, no returns to the table at all, and offers for refill of any drink, nothing once again.  We finished eating and sat there for about 30 minutes waiting on a check.  During that period of time another group of six people came in and were seated across the room. 

Finally, the waitress came and re-read all the ticket items off again, asking which items for which checks.  She had it divided up on the tickets correctly the first time, and we stated that, yet she now was switching things from one ticket to another for it to be rung up.  We also pointed out that we never received the cranberry juice or flan, so it would have to be taken off.  She finally came back, and again, read it off, and of course, had it wrong because she had switched things, but we just accepted the tickets the way they were and exchanged money across the table between us to make it right.  But we pointed out AGAIN that we never received the cranberry juice or flan, so it would have to be taken off.  The waitress said we had to pay for them, so they would box them up for us to take home with us.  The ticket holder with the cranberry juice said forget it, and she would just pay for the juice because she didn't want to wait longer for another ticket - and she paid for it and said just pour it down the sink.  I said I did not want the flan to go, and this also happened earlier in the week and seems to be a scam or just very poor service.  If you can't remember to serve something then just take it off. The older lady argued that they were very busy with so many people to serve (remember 7 of us and then later, 6 other people came in, that was it).  Then she said the waitress would be penalized for it and have to pay for it.  At this point, I was getting pretty angry.  I said "that sounds like a personal problem that is not mine, but screw it, just give me the check because I'm tired of waiting too and I'll just pay for it, but I will never be back here again."  I finally received the check, minus the flan, but they had added 18% gratuity to it for the crappy service - added to my check alone for four people, not the other checks.  This was absolutely ridiculous.  They didn't deserve 1% tip let alone 18%.  I paid, left and will not ever return to this scam artist practice again, nor will I recommend this problem business to anyone else.

the biggest problem i have about this place is the attitude of the servers and the hostesses. the employees  are a bunch of assholes and food isn't that great..who has time for this shit when LV has some of the best food in the world..fuck'em where they breath..

This place was horrid!!! Took us 45 minutes to get our drinks and the food was served about an hour later! Not only was the food and drink order wrong but they did not care and charged us anyways!!! Bartender could not make a cherry bomb shot or any other shot we asked for. Save your money and go somewhere else. 
The only positive was that I could charge my phone while I was there so I could leave this horrible review.
Such a great dinner!  Everything we had was so good and it was so much fun to order a bunch of dishes and share them with family!

Muy buena la comida y la atención no le doy 5 estrellas porque pedimos 2 cosas que no había ni avocado relleno de camarón ni chorizo pero el lugar es muy ameno y recomendable al mediodía para la familia los mejores moros con  cristianos
Great Cuban Food!! and Bakery I really recommend this restaurant yummi!!
Love this place. We have been coming here frequently for their Cafe con Leche / Cortadito and Cuban sandwiches. Service is great and fast. Plus ample of parking.

If you love Cuban food then you will love Florida Cafe!!  I went there years ago when it was a hole in the wall outside Howard Johnson's.  It has since been remodeled and the restaurant and separate dining room are lovely.  Not to mention the buffet is awesome!!  For $10 they have everything Cuban -- ropa viejo, empanadas, lechon, BBQ pork, yuca with garlic, black beans and rice, maduros, salads, desserts and more.  There were five of us and the bill was only $55 including tax.  You can't beat that!  The waitress was very helpful and I can't wait to go back.
The food was decent, not my favorite cuban restaurant; though, the customer service was great and mojitos are really good,  i suggest trying the Coconut Mojito.

I thought this place was very welcoming.  I was wary of the location, but my friend and I were greeted warmly upon arrival and we felt immediately at ease.  We were given recommendations once we said it was our first time and I loved everything I tasted!  I had the papas rellenas to start and the chicken a la plancha as a main.  My friend had ham croquettes and salmon.  I ordered a cafe con leche which never came, so I asked for it once our mains came.  There was a miscommunication because I was charged twice but only received one.  We did not complain as we had to leave and go back to work.

We make it a point to eat here at least once when we come to Vegas. The food is great and prices are pretty reasonable. The staff is friendly. We miss the little Cuban grandma that used to greet us and seat us. But she has since passed away.  It has a wonderful atmosphere and live music some nights.

We came to eat here while we waited for the Reverend. The service was horrible. The food was was terrible. They double charged us for drinks and totally disregard our order. Some items never came to the table. The food took over an hour to arrive. No apologies were issued. I wouldn't recommend it.

The small restaurant was cute, the service was good not great the $5.00 breakfast was ok and the reason it was okay is because it hash brown were the pre packaged, pre cooked type (McDonald's hash-browns) yet our wait time was inexcusable because all that had to be cooked were the eggs. (You need to know that we were the only customers at the time that we ordered).  

The music at night sounded great, this is a place I will visit again because the hotel was great and the price was great.
Excellent Food and service The grilled chicken and soup are to die for....The music goes with atmosphere...The perfect choice for a Sunday Fmaily Dinner.

Vegas has 10000 restaurants or more, but only 2 cuban restaurants. Very rarely do I hand out 5 stars. This place deserves it. Do yourself a favor and visit this amazing place. Order a mojito,  order the oxtail, then order the Cuban espresso. This is how to enjoy the full experience!
Great Authentic Cuban food!! I tried the, Croquetas de Jamon and Papa Rellenas con Alioli and Empanada de guava. 5 start ratings!! Must try!

If I could give this place 0 stars for lack of service, I would. I took my mom out to eat here, but encountered the worst service we have had. The name of the waitress was Dunia (338). She was not friendly at all and was rather dismissive about our requests to get utencils and other items.

I've been dying for an authentic cortadito since getting hooked on them in Miami. It was the first thing I asked for when I stepped through the doors! Hello?! Who knew Vegas had a great Cuban spot! When the manager showed me to what felt like a private buffet room, I was sold. My mouth watered as I passed the Tres Leche cake, glistening Maduros, and Pollo a la Plancha! For $10, all you can eat? If I could will myself to stay at the Howard Johnson, I might eat here everyday!

Food is excellent. At the end of the day Managment made it right but I order food for a party and it was almost an hour late for pick up and they wanted the charge me 35% more then the quote. The owner fixed it all and gave us extras so I give them high ranks for that.

I was so excited to try this place, and was sadly a bit disappointed. The food tasted great, but the portions weren't quite there. We got a couple appetizers and for 3 people, it didn't cut it. The Cuban sandwich app. Came with three small pieces and the papa rellenos came with 2 or 3 and I just didn't feel you got what you paid for. The main dishes were delicious, but again, a bit overpriced for what you got. $6 for 4-5 slices of plantain is a bit much to me. The waitress also made it seem like they came with the meal, and we were surprised when we were charged for them on the bill. Don't get me wrong, it was a tasty meal, but it was a bit overpriced and the one waitress wasn't as hospitable as the others. I'll have to try some other Cuban cafes to compare prices and plate size. Cute little place with yummy food, but a bit pricey.

Ate here this morning. Worst service I have ever had. We ordered coffee and 3 French toast breakfast - nothing too complicated. There were 4 tables of small groups and it took us an hour and 45 minutes to leave. We waited an good 9 minutes to have our drink order taken. And then another 10 to actually get the coffee (after we asked for it). The waitress came back to verify our order after 20 minutes of waiting. And still brought that out wrong. The food was good but service was a negative 1 star!!!!

I remember years ago this place was pretty good.  Plenty of food, great serivce, great prices.  I came back home bragging about it and telling my bestfriend that I needed to take her there one day and try some delicious cuban food.  I was raised in Miami but unfourtunately live in Utah now so the closets thing I have to get my hands on real cuban food is Vegas.  Anyway,  I went back to this restaurant and actually brought my bestfriend with me.  I was exhausted from walking the strip(big mistake)  and we both looked exhausted.  When we arrived there,  I noticed they had a wedding going on and the staff was taking care of them. I thought it was going to be great because besided the party we were the only other customers there.  The prices went up on the menu but it didn't bother me that much because I thought the food was worth it.  Our waitress was the most HORRIBLE waitress I've ever had.   I think we had three different people taking our order and one was trying to rush us in ordering our food when we barely got the menu.  Let just say that we ordered and no one ever brought my food out.  They brought my friend's plate out but not mine and no one ever came back to check up on us.  I also ordered a mojito and our waitress was so bad that the bartender brought it to our table.  I was furious especially after I bragged about how great this place was.  My bestfriend let one of the staff member know that I never got my food..  This was one tab too. They wanted to take my order again( after I've already repeated it to the third person) and after my friend had already finished eating her food.   I told them I didn't want anything except my tab.  I didn't leave a tip and I'm one of those people that ALWAYS tips.  My father in law decided to email them about the horrible service I had and they never responded back.  Luckily, I found a way better cuban cafe( 2055 east tropicana ave) with great food, great service and great price.  I've been there now about five times and brought friends over that have loved it as well and have gone back.

This place customer service honestly in my opinion, does not deserve not even one star. I entered, some lady greeted me which I liked. I went ahead to the bakery side to pick up a cake for a birthday. Nobody was there to help. There were plenty of employees there and no one helped. Mind you they weren't busy, it was empty so there were only like two tables with customers. The lady who greeted me saw me heading that way and did not think to come and help. My sister had to go to the bar to tell her to help us. She clearly saw my sister heading her way and she just ran off, until my sister stopped her. We finally get our cake, but they had no boxes. Don't get me wrong, the cake was beautiful, but the service could be better! Another thing, my sister went before to dine in, and said that they did not help her. She even asked if they are ever going to help and some lady at the bar just looked at my sister up and down with a mug face. Horrible! Very judgmental and just overall horrible service. They should really work on their customer service and their attitude.

This place is a rip off !! And i mean that literally ! Every Cuban knows that when you order pork /lechon / pernil ? It comes with Rice ,beans and Yuca! I came with my fam and we were charged $14 fr the pork rice n beans and $6 dollars each yuca! Alleging it was a "side dish" i had also ordered "tostones" 3 fr $6 that was my " side dish" and a salad !  On top of eveything was bad cold and the waitress was nowhere to be found no refills no napkins ! Never again!

A local friend took me here when I visited town. Staff was friendly and seated me right away, the place wasn't busy or anything. I was offered some suggestions on drinks and tried a pineapple mojito which was ok but not strong at all, actually couldn't taste any liquor. Ordered the salmon which came well done though I asked for medium on the fish but it was covered in sautéed onions and peppers and seasoned very well. Rice and black beans were great. My friend had ox tails and I tried some and they were really good.

The food and atmosphere is great, the staff is nice but very slow in getting your food to you even when the place is not busy. I've eaten there many times through out the years and I just know that the food out weighs the slow service so I keep coming back.

I have very mixed feelings about my experience here. We arrived one evening about 21:30  when it was not crowded at all and decided to give Florida a try.  Note: The parking entrance is where you turn into the nearby hotel parking lot.  There is a sign but we passed it the first time not knowing.   

We were promptly seated and served water.  I did not want a heavy meal so I started with the Ceviche de Camerones.  The dish was well presented but the flavors were just so-so.  The rest of the meal was a Sandwich Cubano Especial which quickly disappeared and was deemed pretty good.  My pet peeve is that during the meal, the waitress got lost somewhere so much so that we had go serve ourselves more water.  That move tanked the meal.  However, when the waitress realized that we were displeased, she deducted some from the bill as a good gesture trying to make it right.  That was cool.  The bakery had some interesting desserts which looked awesome.

I never thought I'd say this but this place is better then my Cuban grandmothers kitchen. 

I seriously had to stop eating and compose myself because I was about to have a Food Orgasm (yes this sounds raunchy) but I cannot describe it any other way. Plus what better place to have one of those, then in Vegas, across a strip-club and the famous Little White Chapel of Love. 

Everything was magnificent (and I seriously tried everything). I'll definitely be making a trip back to Vegas just to eat here.

If I could give this place negative stars I would. To start off we waited 10 minutes for the waitress to even acknowledge us. When she finally did we didn't get a smile or even an apology for taking so long. Brought everyone the wrong items. Forgot half of our drinks. Then she seemed irritated when we asked for what we originally ordered. To top it off our food was cold. Don't waste your time. Burger King would have been a much better choice.

My family and some friends of ours decided to try this place out for our first time. We go out to eat quite a bit and are the typical foodies. We arrived at this place and sat at a table and ordered for our family the bistec, plantains, cuban sandwich, camorones, rice and beans. We had a total of 4 in my family and my friend that arrived he had 3 in his family, so 4 adults and 3 children. We tried their food and it was ok but nothing to brag about. The service was lousy and our server forgot to bring my daughter's order. At the end of our dinner we asked for the bill to be split and so they did but they added their own tip on to the bill without telling us. My friend didn't see that on his bill so he added a tip on top of the tip that was put on to the bill by the waitress. I noticed on my bill so I questioned my bill and asked why the gratuity was added. She said we had a party of 6 or more and that she had to charge that. I told her I didn't see any sign and it wasn't posted anywhere and that it was wrong to charge us when we were going to add a tip to the bill anyways. Tips are not mandatory and are given voluntarily for good service. She was extremely rude and walked away. My friend received a refund for the double tip and as we complained we asked for a manager. Some guy came from the kitchen and stared us down and I asked him if he was the manager and he didn't say a word. We also were overcharged on our drinks. $4 each for a coke. This is not a good way to treat a local and I will let everyone know friends and people that go out to eat to stay away from this restaurant. Their are too many great restaurants in Vegas to have to deal with bad quality food, poor service, and dishonest staff.

We ate dinner here the first night we stayed at the Howard Johnson. This place is attached to the motel. So we just wanted to eat and go back to our room to prepare for our convention day the next day. The food was decent. The wait staff could care less about you but the food showed up hot and fast. 

We did go to the bar every night we were here. There was one really nice bartender the first night and we started talking and she said that she would be there all that week and she wasn't there any of the next nights. So she was great but may be they frown upon personal human interaction here. 

We ate breakfast here every day and it was OK. My husband, which is rare, had a terrible breakfast most of the days. He hated eating there but it was right there and we could be on our way to the convention center. Nothing spectacular.

My Cuban hubby ordered Ropa Viejo (my personal fave!), with yucca on side, which he said was pretty good, tho the beef was a bit heavy on the tomato sauce, while I ordered a Cuban Sandwich, with maduros on side. The maduros, which I had been looking for ward to, were NOT sweet at all, as they should have been. He had a mamey shake, which he said was excellent, & I splurged calories on a chocolate shake. Shakes are fantastic! Made w/ milk & ice cream. Soo good! The service was very, very good! A nice evening, decent food, but too expensive! This is all we ordered, and the bill for the 2 of us, came to $49.16. WAY TOO MUCH!!!

For a cuban restaurant well over priced on some items , not bad taste at all ! When in rush don't expect good service . Really nice casual place . But portion are small !! sorry for the review I am comparing to the Cuban restaurant in PUERTO RICO . Anyway it's a lot better than any fast food ! Enjoy
O love this place the food is amazing my favorite dished is oxtail, sweet banana,  White rice the staff was very friendly and attentive thanks

Just left this place and it's the worst service I have ever received. No communication in this place at all had drinks added to bill I didn't order asked server to remove and was given attitude. Food was ok but service is really bad. I won't be back.
Came for an authentic Cuban experience. The food was bland, fried with minimal sauce. The staff was friendly and the mojito gave me a quick buzz, but I would not return.

I keep coming back for the Tres Leches Cake!!!   I come whenever I'm in Las Vegas not only for the cake but because everything on the menu that I've tried has been very good!   Service is  good and there is ample parking in the back.  Don't miss it!

Tragic.  Florida Cafe used to be the place to go.  Good food.  Great drinks.  Great environment.  However; current management do not seem to care about carrying on the tradition of old.  Poor/horrible waiter service.  Takes forever to order your drinks and food.  Even longer to get it.  In terms of the food itself, well, the chicken is always overcooked/dry. Even when you stay safe and order the black beans and rice, they still can't seem to get the order to you in a reasonable amount of time.

Listen up - Florida Cafe.  You guys were once a favorite local spot to go to ... now, it's actually really easy to keep driving past your restaurant.  As a former customer, it was easy to look beyond the hotel parking lot structure ... and even easier to deal with Strip traffic to reach your location.  But now you aren't worth the fuel to get there ...  let alone the headache to deal with the excessively loud music, the terrible service, and the mediocre food.
Excellent Food and Services of Cuban Cusine, I recommend  this Restaurants  to all my Friends of South Florida

I found that the restaurant has really made an effort to change.  The service was fantastic.  The food was really a vast improvement.  The staff and owner acknowledged the problems.  The owner Sergio mad a huge effort to change our mind about this restaurant.  We went on a slow night so we saw the owner making improvements to the restaurant.    You should check out this historic restaurant.  You will find a cafe with a new invigorating sense of drive to serve their customers.  I would visit again, now with the food and service back up to standards.

BUENISIM!!! I'm so happy we came here on our Vegas trip! We're from Miami and live in LA and this is the best Cuban restaurant by far in the West Coast! From their croquetas, papa rellena to their picadillo & palomilla! And their cafe cubano was AMAZING! Prices were great, service was awesome! We will definitely be back! Delicious!!!!

Food was great. ...excellent customer service. . We went during world cup finals,  great environment. .. food was served quickly,  decent price,  casual environment. . We will go back next time in vegas.
Top notch food and service. Wait staff was amazing and personable. Every bit as good as the Cuban food in Miami.
This is a great place for Cuban or Latino cuisine. The food is delicious and the people are so friendly. I love to dine here when I come to Vegas.

Amazing.  Felt just like Florida. Good music great customer service and the food was perfect.  First time here today. Had a cafe con leche and a sandwich Cubano.  The bread was crisply and flaky. The pork was so soft and ham was just perfect.  One of the best sandwiches I've had in a while.   Try it out.  Good people.

I went to Florida cafe a few times a few years back and loved it! I always ordered the Cuban sandwich and it came with a pile of steak fries. The portions were good, and the food was tasteful. The wait staff was prompt, and attentive. I haven't been in a few years due to being out of town for work. However, I returned to Florida cafe on 6/10/15 with my girlfriend she was excited to go due to the rave reviews I had given it. We came in and was greeted by the waiter immediately and seated right away. We both ordered the Cuban sandwich and fries. Our mouths watered in anticipation. After about 10 minutes our food arrived and my disappointment showed on my face immediately. The sandwich was small and hardly filled at all, and the famous steak fries had been replaced with a dismal, small pile of over cooked previously frozen shoestring fries. The sandwich had little to no taste. The pulled pork was dry and flavorless and they used a couple ham cold cuts on top of that. The pickles were soggy too. However the waiter was good and kept our $3.00 a piece cokes filled up. I would not recommend Florida cafe to anyone. Sad that a few years ago I told everyone to try this place out.
