Really sad how much it's gone down hill.

Do NOT go here!  TERRIBLE service and less than ok food. We waited 45 mins for 4 drinks. Waitress claimed to be busy. Was NOT busy in there. Language barrior....sent my friends a soup they did NOT order.  Told waitress they didn't order it. They still made them  pay for it even tho they didn't order it or eat it or even try it! It took OVER 60 min to get our  appetizers. Asked for our check. ...30 minutes went by no waitress no check so we had to walk up to the bar to get check. They refused to separate it for us....are you kidding me? Do not go here! Worst spot in vegas! Seriously.  Ruined our night

The plaintains are yummy, there is not much fresh & healthy, but the spices & sauces on the meats are really well done.

Service is awful, probably because they force you to pay an 18% tip, on a buffet no less.

It is a little 'dirty feeling'. And a bit expensive for what you get at the buffet. Should be $10 not $15 (plus tip).

We stopped by for dinner on a Friday evening. The service is friendly, but they aren't very familiar with their own menu. The food is, unfortunately, not very well prepared. There are a few other Cuban restaurants in town that charge similar prices for much better tasting food.

Living in Las Vegas for awhile, I never heard or really spotted this place, until my boyfriend's mother introduced me to it. It's attached to a hotel, it's a small cute place. The decor is Miami style, hence the name Florida Cafe. Let me tell you, bring someone who speaks Spanish, and knows what to order, because I was clueless on that part.

I had the special which was rice, beans, and chicken. The food was satisfying, the bread went endlessly into my mouth lol. Everything was tasty, and the "usually" wait time for food. 

The service was pretty good, the waiter joked that I should pick up Spanish. Overall there wasn't anything I disliked, other than maybe the drinks being overpriced.

Great food and great service. I am a very picky eater, and hold a high standard. I was in Vegas for only 3 days and literally went there everyday. I had the ropa vieja, pernil and papa rellena. The papa rellena was the best I've ever had. The ropa vieja and pernil was also on another level. The place is very clean, and is decorated very nice.
I love the atmosphere and music.. the service is good and their menu is reasonably priced.

BOMBBBBBBB. Great food and service. Everyone was so friendly and attentive. Some of the best bread I've ever had! The shakes are amazing. And food is all honestly delicious. Even if I don't stay at this hotel I would most definitely stop by here next time I'm in town.

We ordered some Cuban sandwiches to go and some tostones(fried plaintains). The Cuban sandwiches come with an order of fries btw, they were very good. You get a small container of mojo(garlic & lemon juice dressing) so you can add it to your sandwich to your liking. The tostones were not very good. They were way to big and thick cut. Tostones should be thin and crunchy, these were way to thick and chewy, and not crunchy at all. If you take the sandwiches home and press them a little longer in your George Foreman grill, they are even better! :P

This restaurant was my all time FAVORITE to go to when in Vegas, but this time they fell short. I renewed my vows and had made a reservation for 20 people 1 month before the celebration. Once the ceremony was over we walked to the restaurant and it appeared as though they were not expecting us, but I figured, no problem its fine. Waitress took our orders, and 1 hour and 15 minutes later we get our food COLD and we did not all get our food. Some of our guests had to wait an additional 20 minutes to get their food. I was so embarrassed. After all I had hyped up this restaurant!! Mind you the plates were hot, but the food was cold. We sent the first plate back, and one of the waitress gets upset and gave us an attitude about. We ended up sending 6 plates back and the rest of us did not eat our food. One of my guests asked to speak to the manager. Managers customer service was HORRIBLE. She stated that since we had not made a reservation they were not expecting a large party. My friend stated that there was a reservation made and manager stated she was lying. She then stated that the best thing she could do was give us a cake. Really? Finally she stated she would give us 10 percent off our bill. Then another waitress came out and was so apologetic. She stated that there had been a reservation, and they had just missed it. She apologized and stated this had never happened. I stated that I knew because they had always had exceptional food and service. I stated that what made things worse was her managers attitude. This waitress did make up for her manager. She was sincere and handled the situation well.  The manager never came over to our table to apologize or ANYTHING. Mistakes are made, we are all human, but to have an arrogance the way she did was horrible. I am sincerely sad to say that I will never be going back there and all of our friends who are usual customers will never go back. They ruined such a special occasion, due to their lack of professionalism.

THANK YOU!
Our bicycle club stopped by last night & had an INCREDIBLE time!! Staff, Food, & Drinks were amazing!! Management was  very accommodating with us! Made sure our bikes were parked safely!! We will be back for sure!!!

The food was good...However... There was a  waitress that was extremely rude... We requested a song from the DJ.. As soon as it began she came up and ask the DJ to change it!.. When leaving the resturant She again came up to us a questioning why we we' re still there... Basically pushing us out the door but we we'er still waiting for our credit card because we wernt done paying.... We will never go there again.
4 years since my last visit and review of this place, and still have the WORST customer service ever.
The food is delicious 5 stars, but the service isnt very good. No hosters, the servers were having a loud conversation with the bartender and a costumer. They werent really nice.
Awesome extremely great Cuban food in Downtown Vegas. The portions were good and finger lickin good!!!!

Terrible costumer service and even worst management. Good not even worth what u pay for it. Came here honestly cause was in the area with a friend who was curious about Cuban food but left really disappointed and definitely not a pleasant experience. Let alone when u have to ask for water and bread. Truly sad cause Cuban it's one of my favorite cuisine but not if is coming from this place that's for sure.

So we got married down the street at Viva Las Vegas Wedding Chapel and needed somewhere close by for our 30ish visiting guests to eat after the ceremony, without worrying of them getting lost. I live in San Diego and therefore had to do all the planning over the phone, but I didn't think it would be a big deal.

I called Florida Cafe well in advance and alerted them to my large party of 30 and said we'd just want to eat the buffet, but I wanted to make sure they had a big enough space for us and that it was okay to bring our own cake. The owner was very agreeable and said they could definitely accommodate us and offered to have me come down to the restaurant and talk to him about the plans. We were having sort of a language barrier, I think, but I told him I lived in California so I wouldn't be able to come and chat. I re-confirmed that he had us set for 30 people at the buffet (since I wasn't sure he was getting what I wanted) and he said yes and that was it. I called again a few days before the wedding to make sure our reservation was still in order and everything was great. I also confirmed that we could drop the cake off beforehand and they had no problem with that.

After our ceremony all the guests walked over and started grubbing. My husband and I lagged behind and took photos, etc. When we got to the restaurant everyone was thoroughly enjoying their food and we tried to get some, but even when you have a chapel wedding in Vegas, you're still overwhelmed and have people coming at you from every direction, so I barely got a chance to eat anything. What I did eat was very tasty. The restaurant provided my husband and I two free glasses of champagne, which was very nice. Everyone raved about how great the food was and we pretty much had the room to ourselves. They even helped coordinate when we wanted to cake brought out. Overall it was a total success.

Here's my only complaint and the reason I mentioned what I did in the second paragraph: While we were sitting there in the middle of all our guests, the owner walked up to my husband and I, congratulated us, and then proceeded to scold me for not coming down to the restaurant to talk about food options because he could have given us a better deal or something like that. First of all, do NOT scold me on my wedding day in front of all my guests. Secondly, I think it's tacky to talk about payment for the food the guests are eating, in front of the guests. His tone was so, almost accusatory, that it created an awkward moment of he and I staring at each other and my guests all looking back and forth between us. I didn't even try to hide my annoyance with him and reminded him again that I live in San Diego and wasn't able to come down and talk to him and we were just fine with the buffet, thankyouverymuchnowgoaway.  

Other than that, I totally recommend using this facility for a fun location for your post-Viva Las Vegas Wedding Chapel reception. If you're able to, though, I guess you better go sit and talk with the owner. Jeez.

We came here because we wanted something other than overpriced casino food, and I thought Cuban food would be perfect, I had the chicken and rice and it was pretty good, it could of been a little more moist but stil good. The server had a great attitude and then the manager came over and greeted us and was quite the people person, we had a great time and was treated like family by the end of our dinner. Well be back.

This is an embarrassing review for this location, watch out! 
(Note: My family and I speak Spanish, so this entire visit should have been easier for them since it was said in their native language)

This used to be the hot spot for the Cuban community to get the best food, and within the last year it has gone to $h!t. 

The biggest complaint is the service:

-Ordered a rum and coke. The waitress gave me a coke in a regular cup (took a sip to make sure) and I asked where is the rum. "Why would I put rum in it? *laughs*" UM. Because that's what I asked for? She said she would fix my order, then went to the bar to chit chat with the cook and got herself a water to drink. I had to remind her again about my drink. My drink was a watered down coke with rum. Whatever.

-They usually give you bread with butter to start off while you wait for your food. When we finally got our food we had to ask for the bread,  and they acted like it was an inconvenience. 

-The yuca was not even cooked all the way. Dry. We complained that something was wrong with it and they said that's how it always was. Later they gave us the mojo that should have already been on there.

-They forgot my daughter's food completely. They didn't even get her anything to drink. Actually..

-They never brought us water. Or asked us for a refill. We had to chase them down just to get a drink. I knew they had water somewhere because of that watered down cocktail I mentioned above.

-When they brought our food the waitress didn't say the right name of the plate. We send it off and then found out it was our food but she didn't know what it was called- so she called it something completely different. Shouldn't you know your menu?

-The food was served cold. If I wanted cold food I can open my own fridge and be too lazy to heat it up myself. 

-The waitress began to show frustration with us when we kept having to get on her to do her job...shocker. Not surprising there is an attitude behind the laziness. 

-Our food came out sporadically. She kept forgetting our orders so it was never all placed at once. 

-The waitress gave my 2-year old a knife for her fries. Let that sink in for a moment. 

Here is the kicker, are you ready for this? 

The owner was watching this the entire time. He didn't care about the issues going on in front of him. He ignored us when we wanted to talk to him about the issues. 


Well done, Florida Cafe. You ruined your own reputation.
Bring your appetite they will serve up a fantastic meal that will fill you up! Try the Churasco it was fantastic!!!!

We had our wedding reception at the Florida Cafe, the food was amazing!  The drinks were big and delicious!  We reserved the back room, and had a giant space available for us as well as a great DJ set up.  It took a little while to get things started, it seemed we were a little early and the staff was not entirely ready for us.  Once things got going, however, the wait staff was INCREDIBLY helpful and pleasant and hard working.  The food came out fast and everyone was very pleased.  The manager, Sergio, really made sure that the whole price was affordable and that we were taken care of.  Overall it was a great experience, and I hope the Florida Cafe will continue to host great parties like ours.

Very good Cuban cuisine with attentive service in a nice atmosphere.  Many dishes are simple preparation and delicious.  wanted to return again while in Sin City but will have to wait till the next trip.  Really enjoyed it tremendously.

I made 3 visits to this place. On my first visit this place blew me away. I was so happy we had found this place. The food was great, and the service was great too. The atmosphere was awesome, and we felt like we were back home or in our country.
Soon after our first visit we decided to go back a second time. Now on our second time back, our experience was different. Service took a lot longer than when we went the first time. Not sure if it was because we went on a Sunday but it was a lot slower. We ordered the same dishes because we were so blown away with them from the first visit. Now, when we finally go our food, we started to eat and noticed that the flavors were off, Didn't taste the same as the first time we came. We still enjoyed our food but still wasn't the same.
Now on the 3rd visit, the experience just went way down. Not only were the flavors of the dishes way off again but the level of service also went down. Our first server seemed frustrated. After she took our order she walked off and we never saw her again.We ended up being taken care of a guy that kept forgetting dishes from our order, forgot our drinks.  Usually they give you a little basket of delicious bread before your meal. Well this time we got our bread while we were eating our main course already. we must have been half way through our meal when we received the bread basket and it wasn't fresh. It was hard as a rock and not warm at all. We were so dissapointed. We wanted to really love this place but the sudden plunge in the level of consistency in both food quality and service just completely turned us off. We haven't returned since. I would love to give this place another try. Maybe in the near future I will. I know for sure i will be going to get some of their baked goods.

Last time I'll be here , Mexican music at a Cuban spot? Long wait for bad food, attitudes from the manager and they forgot to place the order for one of the kids. The response from the manager was, " economy is bad so less food at the menu price". $23 dollars gratuity already in my bill for this ?

In the past two years this place has really gone down hill. The service is horrible (absolutely terrible). The food takes a long time to come out, the waiters do not refill drinks, and the food is overpriced. I would not recommend this place at all.

A classic Cuban eatery. This place is unbelievable, offers heaping portions, is priced right, and away gives me a piece of Havana but with Desert like undertones. I have frequented this place for over 8 years and I am never dissatisfied. Plus the owners nail classic dishes like Cubano and Bistec sandwiches on the head. The grilled Pork Chops are to die for too!!
The best cuban food in Las Vegas Strip great flavor and a friendly  atmosphere if you are in Las Vegas come here is great.

This place was my first experience eating Cuban food.  The service was terrible and the food wasn't anything to rave about. I don't know that the waitress can be blamed for the service. The place was packed and from my understanding there was only one cook. At one point I got up and got a pitcher of water to refill my tables glasses.  Management really should've started turning people away in my opinion. 

The food was ok. I got some kind of steak with onions and rice on the side. I'd go back to try something different just in case it was an off night for them.

Meh. . . I had some really, really dry Vaca Frita here. The place is nice and the staff friendly, but this isn't the place to score good Cuban food. It is next to the Little White Wedding Chapel though. Extra star!
Empanadas aren't pie based. They give 2 medium size meatballs on the TAPAS section of menu.

We went here today for lunch. Wish they had an outdoor area to sit and eat but the indoor dining area was nice enough. I ordered the Desayuno Americano and the steak ensalada. The breakfast was nothing special, but i deserved that ordering an American style breakfast in a Cuban restaurant! They also did not get my order right but were quick to fix it when I mentioned the mistake. My salad was decent and the steak in it was delicious! 

Our major complaint was the service. In addition to getting my order wrong (forgivable on its own), it took our waitress forever to notice we were waiting for our bill and she forgot to bring us a water we had requested. Silverware was also a bit dirty. We do plan to return but hope the service will be a bit better next time!

UPDATE: we returned a few months later and service was a bit better, but not a night and day difference. Our waiter seemed to prefer talking to a nearby table that spoke spanish.
Away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We told the Mgr that it was our first time eating Cuban food.  We let him order for us. It's my new favorite cuisine.
Awesome service! And food was authentic Cuban with great prices! Ask for bartender Richardo/ Ricky! ;)

Yum!! The food is good and they have a good variety of choices. The addition of the bakery is amazing! I love the ropa vieja, my husband loves the cuban pizzas. The coffee is a must and the bread!!! The bread is made on site and good Cuban bread. People complain about the service but us Cubans love to talk so they are probably busy talking to another customer but once you get your turn I bet they are super nice to you!! We love Sergio the owner !!
I love Cuban food but was a little disappointed. The service was really slow and it wasn't even busy. The worse part is that they have good food.

Amazing food and drinks! They have the best Mojitos, i love how they have bigger glasses now before the Mojitos were in a tiny glass. The wait staff is always very friendly but sometimes it takes a little long to have our food come out

La comida es exquisita. La mejor comida cubana que he probado en USA. Las masas de puerco son sabrosas, los tostónes y yuca igual! Recomiendo este lugar!  los minutos excelentes y el servicio muy bueno también!! Los dulces cubanos riquísimos y el café espresso está hecho a la perfección

I had a pretty bad experience last time I came here. The service was awful and the food was pricey. However, this time around we went to the buffet, so we weren't ordering off the menu and we sat in the buffet area where there were a few people going around to check up on us and make sure our drink glasses stayed filled. 

The buffet is about 10 bucks and it is pretty incredible! They had empanadas, yuca con chicharron, platanos, tamales, arroz con frijoles negros, salad, and many other options which I can't name that were authentic Cuban dishes. They had at least 10 different options in their buffet and that's not including the dessert, which had about 5 different dishes plus ice cream! Did I mention, the buffet includes drinks? Where else can you find a deal this great!?

The food was so full of flavor and mouthwatering! We both got at least 3 plates, which was a little insane, but soo worth it! I've never had authentic Cuban food like this before. Being able to try their buffet was an awesome way to try many different Cuban dishes all at once.

After attacking the buffet, I went to the dessert section. I got like 2 plates of flan, some ice cream, and 2 plates of arroz con leche. Everything was delicious! 

I HIGHLY recommend trying out this buffet. You definitely get your money's worth and it's a great way to try Cuban food if you've never had it before. Although, it might spoil you for life! It is also a plus that you can get some points here from OpenTable, if you have an account. We were able to make reservations for the buffet, which we really didn't need reservations for, and get about 100 points!

After driving around Vegas a little bit, I passed by the Howard Johnsons on Las Vegas Blvd and against my friend's better judgment, we tried out a little Cuban restaurant attached to the hotel: Florida Cafe.

Excellent little place. Well, excellent if you're not vegetarian. While my friend indulged in the one vegetarian entree, I had the chicken over rice with pimentos and peppers. Pretty sure it wasn't the healthiest meal in Vegas, but the taste of the fried yellow rice was enough to put the restaurant on my permanent list. And while the rice was stealing the show, the chicken (I think it was roasted) fell off the bone when I pulled at it with my fork and produced a simple and yet flavorful combination.

Cuban food, at least as done by Florida Cafe, is sweet and slightly spicy, but with a totally separate spice that other Latin or Caribbean food. It doesn't overpower like jerk (Jamaican) or feel dusted in cumin (Latin). Instead, it offers a subtle sweetness mixed with a slight spice.

While I'd heard a recommendation from someone at work, I wasn't expecting much since the restaurant was attached to a HoJos. I think the best way of explaining how good the place was is to tell that they screwed up my first drink order and served me Jack Daniels instead of Jim Beam. And I still have not a bad word to say (about the food--service is a totally different story and not what I talk about here).
All the Cuban locals highly recommended it as the best place to get Cuban food and it lived up to the hype.
The churrasco with chimichurri was delicious. Some of the best chimichurri I've had. The Valencia rice and chicken was pretty good too. They had Ironbeer, which was awesome. Nice music and ambiance.
Food has gone down hill! I have been coming here for years.. Not anymore! Talk about being seated and then never getting any service.. Sad

Been here lots great owners great food. Worth the stop we go here every time we are in vegas or simply driving by. Try the sandwiches and the plantains skip the frys go authentic! Forgot there is also a bakery and night club by the same owners.

Florida Cafe should have an addendum to it.  It should be "Florida Cafe inside the Howard Johnson's".

Food was pretty good, but I have a complaint that is not just for the Florida Cafe, but for all restaurants in general.  If your menu lists what is on a sandwich, typically diners assume that is all that comes on the sandwich.  Please do not list the things that come on the sandwich, and then not include certain ones.  I ordered the Chicken Sandwich, which came with lettuce, mayo and tomatoes.  There was no mention of the grilled onions, of which my sandwich was drowning in.  I don't like onions.  Learned my lesson, I guess.

Overall, the restaurant was nice.  Service was very mediocre.  At one point, I watched our waitress have a 5 minute conversation with her boyfriend in the waiting area.  We were the only people in the whole room, so I know she wasn't busy.

Food was good.  My wife ordered a salad for 8 bucks...which was some chopped up lettuce, one sliced tomato and an avacado.  Not sure she got her money's worth on that one.

Also, for those of you visiting Vegas, this restaurant is technically on the strip, but don't expect to walk there.  Take the bus.  You will thank me!

This is probably the O.G. of Cuban restaurants in Vegas. Not the best Cuban food you can get, but it will hit the spot if your craving Agua De Coco, Tostones, or Arroz con Frijoles Negro. 
The service is great if your Cuban or a regular, and it is just so-so if you're anyone else. 
The waitress had her hips showing, and I thought that was classless. She also refused to make eye contact with me when I needed something. (she wasn't MY server, but it was clear I was in need) 
The location, music, and décor is exactly what it should be. Maybe a little run down and some new booths are in order, but overall not a disappointment.
I have had Cubans cook me authentic food, and this is pretty close, just made in abundance. They do cook your food to order of course, but they use cheaper ingredients and it leaves you wanting a touch more of something. Not sure what, but it ALMOST hits the spot. 
They have been around for years, I would not suggest changing the menu, but simply upgrading a few things. Maybe have a specialty of the week or a secret menu. 
This is a solid average 3 star place. Nothing super amazing, but nothing truly lacking. 
They also offer live salsa music twice a week. 
I am sure the tourist keep them in business, but the regulars are the same people year after year. Places like that always have a home in Vegas in my opinion.

I absolutely Love Florida Cafe. The service is amazing, great music and the food is delicious. I'm addicted to Los Pastelitos De Guayaba y Queso they also have a bakery contacted to the café. Very nice environment to mingle.

Ok...here's the deal. The service is SLOW and pretty awful. We went in the morning. There were only two other tables there and I had to ask the lady twice to serve us. Once we DID get service however, the food was amazing, and worth the wait. Authentic Cuban food! Sand which was amazing and the garlic mojo for the chips even better!

This place was awesome!  Granted, the location could have been better. It's located in the lobby of Howard Johnson WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY down the strip.  However, it's totally worth it ESPECIALLY if you know about good Cuban food! The staff consist mostly of Cuban decent which builds up on the authenticity, and the food is DELICIOUS. The portions could be bigger : / , but it was worth every penny since the food reminded me of my mother's home cooking (of course her pork in the Cuban sandwiches are way better, but it's a good substitution since mother isn't around to always cook them). I really recommend this place; especially if you like mojitos then get yourself down to Florida Cafe because they're serving them for Happy Hour 2-6 :)
When in Vegas i get my Caribbean fix here - papas rellenas - milanesa - bistec encebollado- tostones !!!! Yummmm

Very excited to stumble upon a Cuban place in Vegas.

I keep reading about this $10 buffet which I must come back for but I will write on some items I had for lunch.

The place is located in the Howard Johnson motel in Downtown Vegas on LV Blvd.  It looks pretty seedy but there's something I like about it.  

For food, I ordered the Ropa Vieja, which is shredded beef stewed with tomatoes, bell peppers and onions.  Very flavorful.  

My friend ordered the Pierna de Purerco Asada - oven roasted leg of pork marinated in mojo of lemon, galric, lemon, lime, orange juice.  Very good too.

Some other friends ordered some items that they weren't pleased with but it could be because they just don't have an adventurous palette.

The cuban pork sandwich was pretty darn good.  It's not what you'd get in Miami but it s hard to find great Cuban food anywhere.

The menu is intense -- I'll def be back for buffet which seems to be the best pound for pound value.

I don't know why everybody is giving this place low stars. I like the staff, they are super friendly, and one of the chefs took his time to talk to us when he was done at work.

Anything with chicken is awesome here! The meat falls right off the bone and melts in your mouth. I think I ordered the "Pollo Asado with Cuban Spices". It also comes with black rice with black beans. They told me it was just Cumin and Parsley, but it tasted a whole lot better than that. 

Me and my friend also had the Mojitos here. Both of us drink a lot frequently and we are surprised that the buzz creeped up on us so strongly. I had another half a glass and I got pretty hammered.

Prices are a bit expensive for the portions they give you, but the money is worth it for the quality of the food and drinks. It's really close to my workplace, just right up Las Vegas Blvd.

A common complaint is slow customer service. I thought the speed of service is alright, especially since I came on a slow day, Christmas Eve, where they are plenty of folks rushing to the mall to do late shopping instead.

Will I always come down here? No, I can't afford a weekly habit, but it's a really chill place for a date and I like the atmosphere.

Great food and stiff drinks. The bartender is really friendly and makes for a good conversation.I did go there because it was closest to our hotel in Vegas and I didn't want to walk too far. Glad I found this place.
This is my family's go to place in Las Vegas. If you want authentic cuban food this is the place to go, I haven't had food like this since I was in Cuba itself. Favorite part of every trip!
This place is amazing. If you are visiting Vegas and want an exception meal and a Cuban experience, you must make a stop at this place.

The restaurant is not inside Howard Johnson but next to Shalimar Las Vegas Hotel close to the SLS Hotel. The address on Yelp was incorrect.
Correct address is: 1401 S. Las Vegas Blvd

First time here and we had a party of 9 adults and 7 children. The waitress was very good. Our food came out in a timely manner considering the size of our party. I had the Arroz con Pollo ...  I've never had Cuban food so, I don't know if this dish was supposed to be as dry as it was but, that's what it tasted like. I was really looking forward to the Fried Plantains because I love them everywhere else but, these ones were also dry and had no taste. I did however enjoy the Tres Leches dessert and Guava Juice. Everyone else loved their food which I also posted pictures of but, please don't ask me to name them because I can't remember. Next time, I will go for the Shrimp dish as it looked and supposedly tasted amazing. Overall, I gave it 4 stars because of the service, quality in price and quantity of food given. Will I be back? Yes, to try another dish besides the one I received.

I got takeout from this place once.  It was not great but not horrible.  It was however very expensive.  It seems like its kind of a touristy place so they jack up the price.  Not sure.  All I know is that Rincon Criollo http://www.yelp.com/biz/rincon-criollo-las-vegas up the street is much, much better and maybe half the price..

I went to Florida Cafe on 4/24 with a friend and we both decided that we will not be back for the food. The drinks were on point however the food was not the good. My friend had the ox tails and she said it was fork tender but had no flavor or seasoning. I had the steak and onions it was not fork tender and it had no seasoning. Do not waste your money on the food. We will not be back for the food but for the drinks.
This is One of Vegas's Best Kept Secrets!!!! I had the chicken and rice! Everything was Banging!!! Not to Mention The Beautiful Nicole Murphy was in the restaurant.... I'll Definitely be Back!!!

What a sh*t hole... Obviously no one here has ever been to Cuba or at the least, visited Miami... The food is so nasty, the prices are unbelievable.  Why would a croqueta be $3.00?  Who knows, who cares...People from Vegas hear this:  This is not authentic Cuban trust me I am from Miami with Cuban parents.
Excellent Cuban food. Definitely with the drive downtown. Don't miss it and great atmosphere. Had the Cuban sandwich and the ham croquettas and Cuban coffee.

Been coming here for many years. My dad would swear by it, and so do I.

The ambience is tropical, fun, and infused with sweet music from the Caribe.
The food is just as amazing as the food and their staff. 

Don't be fooled by the location at the front of hotel lobby and wedding chapel. The restaurant delivers where it matters the most, your pocket and your taste buds. Highly recommended. 

*GET THE VACA FITA, POLLO A LA PLANCA or the ROPA VIEJA *

We have eaten at many Cuban restaurants in America including almost all in Southern Florida. My gf is born and raised in Cuba. This restaurant is amazing. Very unexpected but they beat out any of those. 
I read reviews about the service being slow but that's more the culture of Cuban restaurants. They don't disturb the table often unless you motion for them. The custom in America is a little different but shouldn't give bad reviews...you went to a Cuban restaurant for a Cuban experience. Don't fault for that. 
I also read reviews saying the food want "authentic". One comment said "first time eating Cuban food but not authentic". Wow! Unless you are in Cuba how in the world can it be "authentic" like truly. No, it's not Cuba but it's better than almost all other American renditions of the Cuban heritage and food. 
Good job to these guys at Florida Cafe. They operate a great business and take a lot of pride in it. Nice to see.

I love this place, great food, (especially the steak) great service, a great cuban environment, every time I come here I feel like I'm in a little slice of Havana, and the music makes me want to dance, they have a full bar as well, I recommend this place to anyone that loves traditional Cuban style and flavor!!!
this is byfar the most authentic cuban food in las vegas i love it i must eat it at least 5 timeg a momth

I have to give this place a 2 star although I ate here 2 years ago and it was 5 star.  First problem was we were seated and our coffee order was taken and when the coffee was served we were advised there were no eggs for breakfast.  Had we know this before seating and ordering coffee we would  have left.  The coffee was excellent both Cuban Cortaditos but the breakfast was dry and not very tasty.  They only had cuban toast and chorizo.  So I thought ok, when it came it was bread with sliced chorizo on top which tasted like and looked like linguiza with onions on top.  It was so dry and very hard to eat.  We were not offered any discount either.  We will not return.

If you have not tried Cuban food make this your first stop. Start off with a Michelada, they are  Also, try the Red snapper with beans and rice when I tell you it's the best you will come back to my review and SMASH that like button.. The service was fast,  spicy, and friendly. I can't wait to go back. They have a bar next door and I think they have a DJ On Friday's. I was to full to try the bakery but it looked yummy.

I'm always excited to try Cuban restaurants and the food here definitely didn't leave me with a bad experience. I went in for breakfast - can't remember exactly what I had but I know it was hella good!

It's a small restaurant off the strip - doesn't look like much but you definitely have to go in!

The meal was beyond what I expected. We were served warm buttered bread when we sat down. It was flaky and delicious. I had the Papas Rellenas from the tapas portion of the menu. I also ordered a side of the mariquitas and a capuchino. The papas were fresh and the mariquitas (fried plantains) were crispy and lightly salted. I dipped them in the aoili that accompanied my Papas and was dancing a happy dance to the lively Cuban music piped thru the restaurant.  My fiance ordered the El American breakfast:  eggs, bacon/ham, toast, hash browns. All that food came up to a total of $20.54. The service was delightful.  I will definitely come again.

For those of you who don't know, Florida Cafe is the sister restaurant of Havana Grill in Henderson (off of Pebble & Eastern)...same owners. So much for thinking one sister is always prettier than the other.  And I don't know what I was thinking...because I like to give the benefit of the doubt, maybe I should only apply that to friends and not food.  I ordered the Pollo Frito (which I've had at HG as well)...I mean c'mon it's fried chicken. This shit was bland...my napkin had more flavor. Don't. Just don't. You're better off learning how to cook Cuban food at home and not regret spending the money.

Great authentic Cuban food!! Mom and pop so you meet the family and feel like your getting food right from your abuelita!  From the chicken to the steak it's all marinated and cooked to taste and then the bakery has the authentic Cuban cakes!!! It's inside a run down hotel so sometimes I pass it but I always bring people and they are never disappointed either:)

Very nice family-friendly Cuban Restaurant with DELICIOUS FOOD?. The staff is friendly and the food came quickly.  We ordered "croquetas de jamón" and shrimp ceviche- which were both delicious!- and it came with a basket of warm, buttered pieces of fresh bread.  We then ordered ropa vieja with white rice, black beans and fried plantains- which was AMAZINGGG. The congrí was very very tasty as well.  Amazing food, welcoming atmosphere, clean, good music. We will be back..!

Are you ever the person that seems to order the worst menu item in a group of people? I feel like I am that person. Too often probably.

So I will admit, up front, that my review is likely tainted by this dilemma. Let's call it, the my-dining-companions-order-better-then-me-envy. 

I'm guilty of this at Florida Cafe.

We started out the meal with the delicious buttered bread, tostones, and yuca. The fried plantains came with a yummy garlic butter sauce. I would have drunk that sauce straight if I wasn't eating with company.

As for my entree, my favorite dish at the Cuban restaurant back home is vaca frita. I figured I would try it out here for a comparison. It is horrible to come from one place with a magnificent version of a dish to go to another with a mediocre (at best) execution of the dish. The meat, while heavy in quantity, was dry and tasted tired. It was difficult to find any flavor layered in the dish aside from fried beef. C'mon! Instead of the red beans I ordered I was served black beans which was no big deal since I appreciate both kinds. But with a heaping pile of dry vaca frita, I was left feeling let down by my plate.

Thankfully my dining companions ordered better then me or else I might think worse of this place.

One person had the bistec de palomilla empanizada. It was tender, juicy, crispy happy times. I stole a fair share of bites out of that one. The Cuban sandwich looked fantastic and was gone before I could even consider trying it.

We finished the meal with fabulous Cuban coffees. Creamy, sweet, and bold. Ahhhhh. The perfect way to end a meal.

The location is sketch. The ambiance leaves a lot to be desired. But if your timing is right you can peep on people getting married across the lobby and the service in Florida Cafe is incredibly friendly.

This place is an only-in-Las Vegas experience. The restaurant is in a budget motel (Shalimar) on the Strip, in an area that seems not to have changed in 40 years. Park in the rear, and as you enter the lobby you pass the Wedding Chapel. Elvis, or his twin, was in the building waiting to perform a ceremony the day we went. Cross the lobby to the Florida Cafe and you enter an authentic Cuban experience. We had the classic Sandwich Cubano with plantain chips and the also the classic black beans and rice. The garlic sauce (mojo de ajo) was the hit of the meal. It was meant for dipping the plantains, but we put it on everything and asked for more. Service was friendly. We will be back, Elvis.

Okay so I'm only in town for my birthday celebration and I've already eaten here 3 times!! This is definitely authentic cuban food. I tried the arroz con pollo, the bistec, the fried pork (don't remember the name), the papas rellenas, tostones, and the yucca with chicharone all were delicious!!  My favorite had to be the cafe con leche with the Cuban bread. OMG!! I want to go back for more. The only negative would be the service. They were all very nice but may have been short handed. I didn't mind too much though because I was in no rush and the wait was totally worth it once the food was served.

Worst service ever. Food came out at different times. Some were almost finished when the rest of the table got their food. Management was rude. Our waitress only came to our table 3 times. She never checked on us once and never offered to get us any drink refills or anything. I will never go back. They clearly don't appreciate the business.

This place is a little hole in the wall.. stopped here to eat with a great of 6 friends amazing food. . Great atmosphere and service.. I used to live in Miami FL for a few years so its a little hard to find Cuban food. . Let alone good Cuban. . This is now a staple for every time I come to Vegas!! Everyone's food was great.  Very very large amounts of food. . Hot and fresh. . Drinks were also really good. . Will be back thank you. .
Jorge of J or J Welders. LLC just took me to lunch here. The food is excellent!! It is so refreshing to taste this style of cooking. Caribbean cuisine. I will be back with my wfe!!!.

Honestly, I was invited to have drinks and dinner with my family and friends. First time at this place! I was a little worried by the location not the best in town. OMMMMMMMMGGGGGG was I glad I stayed. This place is a hidden gem my yelp friends. Its a must do! What an amazing menu I tried everything I got hooked by the explosion in my mouth full of great flavors. It was very clean and welcoming along with great decorations everywhere. The drinks where definitely A+++ not water down at all... Let me talk about the MOJITO  drink hmmmmmm fantastic I acutally tasted mint outstanding. I wanted to give this place my 5 ***** star approval by far my favorite place to go. The only downside is I had no room for desert I was disappointed but gives me a reason to return. Absolutely a must.. do yourself a favor and go!

being in the area and I enjoy me some Cuban food I wanted to try Florida Café. I wasn't sure where to park so I pulled into the motel and asked if it was ok to park there and we found out that is where you can park. Entering the hotel lobby, the restaurant is at the front of the building, tucked in the corner. We entered and were seated within a few minutes.
It took a few minutes for someone to come to our table but eventually we had a server come with menus and water.
-Cuban Sandwich, Tasty sandwich on the perfect bready, very flavorful and one of the better ones I had in town.
-Sandwich De Bistec. Grilled steak & veggies, caramelized onion and tomatoes pressed on the Cuban bread. my wife ordered this but I ended up with half and I'm glad I tries it. All the components came together to give you a perfect bite every time
- Papas Rellenas- mashed potato/beef fried balls severed with a garlic aioli. They remind me of arancini, jus the Latino version. another excellent dish.
-Masitas de Cerdo al Moho. I want to say they are fried for how crispy they were and marinated in the moho. Fried or not this was some flavorful pork and I would order this again! served with fried plantain pieces and onions.
- Service was I bit slow for it not being busy and the main complaint is the temperature. The fans were on circulating air but it seems like the ac was not on and it got uncomfortable in there after some time. I would definitely come back as the food is worth the visit

This place is awesome, if you like good salsa music and good food this is the place to be. I ordered a mango shake and ropa vieja, it was to die for. The new renovations just made this place even better, one can come dance and dine and feel like you on the island , great place to bring your folks if they are missing the mother land and the strip is walking distance.

Food is marginal. Pastries are great. Service is a bit slow, servers don't speak English very well. 

I've had better Cuban food in Florida! I was here yesterday morning for breakfast, it was okay. I love Cuban food so I thought I'd give it another try. I regret to say it wasn't what I expected so I give it a three star.
Mi favorito!!! Love this place! Coming here since 2003. Great food and service. The owner Sergio is si
When I get to Vegas i come here first thing for the great meal. This place never fails me and the food is always perfect! Love this place

Very disappointed. I used to love this place years ago, today I got super excited we were near by and hungry... ended to not wanting to come back again. 
My favorite dish is very simple. Pork leg (pernil) and fried bananas. The pork they brought was half fat, literally, "gordo" and the other half tasted blend, as if it's been kept in the fridge and heated in the microwave. Some meat was hard too. 
The fried bananas (plátanos) were over fried or re heated after being cooked, not juicy and spongy as they should be, not fresh made for sure. 

Not coming back, I never minded  the service because it's just as bad as it is in Miami - for those  who know what I mean. - but I think that they should keep up the quality of the food for the price they charge
Came with family for breakfast, order 2 eggs , was waiting for 2 eggs more than 30 min, it cooks 2 min!! after I asking check, they bring food,than waiting for change about 15 min

I give it 3.5 stars.
We decided to venture out of touristville to where it is somewhat scary and you see semi-real Vegas. In other words, this place is not among the glitz and glamour of the strip. In fact, it is in a rather seedy area, but it is located within a Howard Johnson's so we checked it out. Across the street is all-nude dance place. Maybe next time....

The food was very good. We started with mini-Cuban sandwiches which came with a plate of fried plantains. The plantains were not greasy at all and the sandwiches were delicious. I got some kind of chicken dish in borth (#94) and the chicken was excellent. The wife got pork from the leg and it was so soft (#81). Can't remember how to pronounce the names. Anyway, it was a really good meal. My main complaint is that although the meat was super tender and moist, neither dish had much flavor, which to me was surprising since I assumed Cuban food would be very flavorful. but both dishes were rather bland. The black beans and rice were flavorful and excellent, but the meat not so much. I would go back because I like ethnic food, but I would ask the waitress for a recommendation that had more flavor.

Excellent authentic wonderful generous portions.

They all describe this place! I have nothing bad to say.

We had the combination appetizer plate and prawns. All were excellent.

This place makes me feel like I am back in South Florida, maybe even a nicer area of little Havana.
I had "The Cuban", it sucked. The bread is everything on a Cuban. The bread sucked. But Maybe that's how they do it in Cuba, so I'll give it 3 stars instead of 2.

The Florida Cafe in Las Vegas is an adventure. It's north of the Stratosphere and south of Downtown on Las Vegas Blvd, attached to the Howard Johnson Hotel (who knew these still existed?). There are lots of sex shops and wedding chapels in the area (apparently, the two things go hand in hand in Vegas - a more honest presentation if you ask me). You pull through the entry way and into the hotel courtyard/parking area and walk on into the lobby entry. Go into the Spanish style entry way off the lobby, and be prepared for the BEST breakfast in Vegas. The Desayuno Cubano is simply heaven. Eggs, Cuban Toast, fried plantains and stuffed potatoes, mashed potatoes that are filled with ground beef and some olive, shaped into balls then rolled in panko bread crumbs and fried, either served on a flat, plate sized piece of ham or not. Heaven! The staff is somewhat unattentive, but them's the breaks. You're at the friggin' Howard Johnson Hotel, not the Four Seasons. For the folks who say it's too expensive, I say go get your dollar hot dog at Slots of Fun or your average prime rib buffet, and pipe down. I, for one, would rather have an experience, and the Florida Cafe gives you that, and a delicious breakfast to boot!
Great Cuban food and even better service. Very gracious people. My family had a wonderful lunch experience.

Went here with a few co-workers, including a Cuban girl. She loves the place and says she forced her husband to come with her every week when she was pregnant.

The location is pretty shady, inside a Howard Johnson on Las Vegas Blvd North. Parking is behind the motel and it's a bit of a walk, but once you get inside, the atmosphere in the hotel lobby and restaurant are nice enough. 

Service was very slow, and our waitress wasn't knowledgeable about the menu. She tried to help my friend figure out what she ordered last time, but most questions were met with an "I don't know". One of my, uh -- less inhibited -- friends started questioning her background - "are you Cuban?" ... "no" ...  "are you a white girl?!" ... "yes, but my mother is from Peru".

The food was good, but very overpriced. I ordered ropa vieja ($12.95), a stew of shredded beef with tomato and spices. You can choose between white rice with black or red beans, or moros y cristianos - a tasty mixture of white rice and black beans with pork broth and a few stray cubes of pork. The side of moros almost dwarfed my saucer of ropa vieja. Another friend ordered a Cuban sandwich, also overpriced at $12.95. Another asked for extra cheese on her ground beef dish and was given one of those stainless salad dressing boats full of uncooked shredded cheese, and charged $2 for it.  They did remove it from the bill when she complained, though. The total for five of us, including two sharing an entree, was $75 before tip.

Overall, the food was good, but I definitely had to dock a couple stars for the service and pricing.
Best Cuban food in Vegas!! Salsa music is on point!! Tips Vieja and Pernil were on point!! We also tasted the platanos Maduros. Great service!

My wife and I came to this restaurant 10 years ago. The food continues to be great. Great pernil and plantains. Service in a scale of 1 to 10, Maybe a 5. I asked for a Stella , they didn't have it. So I asked for a Bohemia, guess what, no Bohemia. They did not clear the table even when I asked for a Flan. I will repeat myself , Great food. My recommendation train the waitresses. Great personalities, just need to work on their service skills.

Folks...This is the BEST CUBAN RESTAURANT I have ever been to. I have eaten at many in Los Angeles, New York, and Miami. This one tops them all. Trust me as a person born and raised in Habana, Cuba. there ROPA VIEJA, CONGRI, LECHON ASADO CON CEBOLLAS, ARROZ CON POLLO, and FRIED PLANTAINS tops any place I have ever visited as pure, delicious and totally authentic! Run and served by pure Cubans. Please check them out. You will not be disappointed! And the funny thing.... It's in VEGAS BABY!

Walking in I was surprised how slow it was on a Saturday night. We waited at the host stand for a while not even getting greeted. When we were, it was one of those "You can take a booth" while a server flew by.

 The service was slow. Our waiter took our order without writing it down.  Of course he came back with the incorrect order, and I waited till the end of the meal for the mojito I ordered finally arrived. When we got the check, about 6 employees went by with their head down. Overall it was terrible service.

The food was uninspiring as well. We went tapas style,will say the empanadas were light and tasty. The ceviche was advertised with large shrimp, and it came with tiny cocktail ones. The cubano sandwich had a weird un-flavorful hunk of pork. The croquetts  were previously frozen. I will say the orange mojito was decent and stiff.

Couple all this a dated disorganized decor, I could of skipped this one. Groupon got me again, but it is in our neighborhood and I can check if off my list.... Where not to eat.

I went to this place just to try something new, we'll let me tell you the food is average and in my opinion bland, when I ask for hot sauce they almost fainted and god forbid that you ask for a refill on your water that puts them over the edge!!! 
I will go back just to see if they can make it better......... We'll see!!

Loved the food. Ordered the oxtails. The gravy was made perfectly the stew red beans and rice. Awesome! The guanabana juice was on point. Only reason why I didn't give all 5stars is because service was a little slow. We had to call them over when we needed help. But I would def go back. The food was on point and the establishment was really clean! Which is rare these days.

Ate there twice, both times very good and the staff was very good.  Would go back for sure.  Out of the two different meal I had , the mini Cuban sandwich was very good!  The ropa veija was ok, had better. Only went there for breakfast and lunch, did not go for the late night crowd, but did see a post on a door saying no one under 21 allowed so I am wondering what is behind that door or that section of the establishment.  Especially since the bar was up front, so I know it was not the bar section but knowing Vegas I don't think I want to know.

Unfortunately I have to say this place left little to be desired food was Ok it was a little salty however, the problem was with the service and manager. I had to ask for a drink refill after waiting close to 45min. Then when asked for my bill I was not charged properly. When I asked the manager to fix it she had a very bad attitude and even complained to her staff about me with me standing there. She was not professional and I would not come back.

The only redeeming quality of this place is the actual food. Service is bad, food is expensive, and portions are small. If you're looking for good Cuban food, there are definitely other places that are much better, just follow the Yelp reviews!

Too expensive for the type of food they serve. I ordered a $13 ensalada playera thinking it was going to be a great meal. I was extremely disappointed. It didn't have cherry tomatoes or roasted peppers as described. The shrimp were mediocre and were the size of a dime. They looked like they had come from a can. Ice berg lettuce instead of a nicer type was served. This was not a spring mix salad as it only had 3 or 4 slices of a cucumber. My wife makes a more delicious shrimp salad then this. Take notes Florida Cafe. My wife uses large shrimp or prawns like in your Enchilado de Camarones, delicious spinach, actual cherry tomatoes, red onions, and vinaigrette dressing carefully mixed. I will never eat there again. If at all I'll just have a beverage.

Great food and service to match. Our waiter did the ordering for us at our request and I highly recommend ordering this way.  Love eating at restaurants like this.  If you're a foodie, you'll want to eat here :-)

This place is one of the best non-Mexican Latin restaurants in Vegas. This place is small and cozy and the food is always fresh, cooked to order and most of the time done in a timely order. For starters the cafe con Leche is amazing, paired with the Cuban toast makes it even better. The rice and beans are always fresh and the spices are seasoned to perfection. I highly recommend this place for breakfast lunch or dinner. They have a full service bar, live music on the weekends. They also have a second location called Havana grill but I haven't been there yet.

Best Cuban food I've ever had! Everyone here is so attentive and friendly.  I love The music and the atmosphere. Definitely going to come back! We got the sopa de pollo and the churraso con chimi churry sooo good! The stake was cooked to perfection, the black beans were so delicious. We definitely going to make it back here! Hopefully we will have room to enjoy desert since we were so full after our main course!

I had a Groupon for the Florida Cafe that was going to expire in a few days so I went here last night to use it and I'm glad I did.  My server was a delightful young woman but we had a bit of a language problem as you'll see during my review.

I looked over the menu and I also asked her suggestion.  She pointed to an oxtail stew that's not on their online menu.  I opted to take her advice.  

I started with their papas rellenas--mashed potatoes stuffed with picadillo beef and deep fried.  Presentation was very nice with two very thin plantain pieces deep freid and stuck in the papas.  There was also a small salad.

The menu said all dinners come with red or black beans and rice.  I specified black beans.  That was the first language mixup.  Not only did I get black beans with my meal but my server brought me an extra bowl of black beans because she thought I ordered an extra dish.  It was good so I ate both!

The oxtail stew was very flavorful.  I think some people might have thought the broth was salty, but it was just great for me.

Dessert order time.  I asked about the size of the tres leches cake tower with flan and coconut.  She assured me it wasn't that large and then she brought me the normal flan and not the tres leches cake.  Language problem number 2.

She asked if I wanted more Coke and I said, "No, iced tea."  She then brought me a Coke.  I didn't notice, but I soon had a table side science experiment.  You have no idea how Coke foams when you put artificial sweetener in it.  I managed to keep little Vesuvius from flooding the table, but I didn't drink the Coke.  Last language error.

I'm going to go back because I really like Cuban food.  I'll also make sure that what I want is a bit more explicit!

Being from Orlando, a cuban breakfast is easy to come by, so when I came here on vacation I searched for one and was excited to find florida cafe. We ordered the cuban toast and cafe con leche with sides of eggs, and it is the perfect.breakfast. the service is a little inconsistent, sometimes we are charged for refills, sometimes we arent, but besides that they never disappoint!

a delight!

Have never had authentic Cuban food before... but then again this is my first time eating Cuban food. Came here for lunch. The host was very friendly and we were seated right away. Did not quite know what to order because I had a little difficulty understanding the menu and the waitress wasn't really helpful (language barrier). Finally ordered the Churrasco con Chimi-Churri and it didn't disappoint... I love meat and this meal was delicious. The meal included rice and some type of sauce that you spread over the rice... the value was excellent (although we used a Groupon deal). It had a large bar and also a room with a dance floor, must be fun during the evenings. I would try this place again.

The second time I visited this place to have lunch with my hubby the place has been renovated and they have added a bakery! Sweet!

Review #0148

"Say good night to the bad guy." (Scarface). That's how authentic and awesome this place is. I was expecting Tony Montana to cause a scene in the back room and walk out all drunk like. I love this place. I have been eating here forever and I love everything on the menu, especially Vaca Frita. There is a fun night club in the back part of the restaurant that becomes live at night with a live band. The bakery is descent, but you are coming here for authentic Cuban food. You feel like you are in Havana and there should be old people in the back playing dominoes. You drive right pass this place if you are not looking hard. It's located in the Shalimar Hotel.

This place has many pros and cons.

The food? Good.  I love that steak sandwich they have there! YUMMY!

The bugs? Bad.  I mean... it's creep to see one or two run across the bar while you eat.

The service? Good.  The bartender they had at the time was great. Made us laugh, and was on top it.

The location? that area the restaurant is in is not the greatest.  Although you get a good view of the strip club from the restaurant.  Sometime they will be swinging outside the club!

Their food is pretty good! I'm particular so I always get the rrabo encendio, which is the oxtail and they always get it right! For dining in the service takes a while but for take out, it's very quick.

The food here never disappoints. Is it far off the strip, yes. Is it inside a Howard Johnson, yes. If you are one to judge it for this then shame on you. The food is simply comfort, delicious and so worth it. I stick to my ropa vieja and have never been disappointed. The service is fast and very attentive. These guys have been around for a while. I can clearly see why. Good food, great prices and great customer service. Can't wait to visit in my next Vegas trip.
Great Place, great food. Very Authentic. The place is clean and theres plenty of parking in the back. The owner is friendly and accommodating. I will continue to go back whenever im in LV.

Food here is awesome.. Service a bit slow though. I got the oxtail stew with white rice and beans, it was awesome. Another good thing on the menu is their fish, it's a whole fish, I couldn't eat it all so I had to save the rest but very good indeed. Wish I snapped a picture before I eat everything

Stopped for lunch- I love the atmosphere! Great food too.. I had the Mini Tamale and Mini Cubano --my boyfriend got the regular Cuban sandwich- it was HUGE! They are very generous with the servings. I will definitely be back! Service was great too- they always came back to check the drinks, always a plus!

This place is quaint & small but a very homey environment, plus you can get a killer drink from the bar. Don't come to this place expecting to sit a group of 10-15. The staff works well together & the food is tasty, believe me I ate breakfast lunch & dinner there!

YUM! Delicious, authentic food. Delicious rice and beans, tostones and Yuca fries. Staff is friendly enough.

This is in an older part of town, near a bunch of "wedding" chapels. It's tucked inside a Howard Johnson hotel. Park in the back.

Clean.
I haven't had Cuban food this good since my father used to cook it for me as a kid. You've gotta come in and try it. The staff is very friendly.

Don't come here if you're starving!!!!!! The service is terribly slow right off the bat. 5 different people came to the table, then ran off. We all got waters and I asked for lemon wedges and the waitress looked at me like I told her to solve a rubics cube! She didn't know what I was asking I told her twice. She ended up bringing me freaking limes. Seriously.??!?!???!!! We had to ask for bread and the bartender took our order? It was so dead yet people were running around for no reason. Every table got bread except for us so we had to ask for it. They forgot about our order which makes sense considering they ran off mid sentence while still ordering! Will not come back again.

This was the worst experience I've ever!!!! experienced at a Restaurant by far!! There was no consideration the fact that I had my three children with me, I kept count about 10 minutes after we were seated it took almost 20 minutes before anyone came to see us.
 At this point we said enough is enough! then of course when we got up to leave some lady came pretended to come our way she saw we were not happy and acted like she was wiping down the table we were at? as people at the bar area looked at us leaving I noticed the waitress waving us off like saying oh well good by!! As a American Cuban I know this type of attitude and behavior it's not acceptable very prideful and rude I don't recommend this place to anyone with kids or looking for good costumer service!
Great Cuban coffee. Great place for a casual summer breakfast. Cuban feel and good solid Cuban food. Cool laid back ambience.

The place is nice, easy to find and large parking, the decoration is great, restaurant clean and staff friendly.
The food is average and it's expensive.

Worse service ever. Went here for my grandmothers celebration of life and we were treated with disrespect and rudeness from the minute we walked in. Waitress couldn't keep track of any orders. Bathroom was discusting and workers use the same discusting restroom. Asked if some one could sell me a patty fro the little pastry shop they had inside and was told no twice. So I walked behind the counter myself and grabbed my pastry. Asked for water 3 X's and never got it. Waitresses must have been pushing the chicken cause every one would order pork and she would come out with chicken and say no you ordered it when no one did. Go talk to thebowner Sergio and his reply was what do u want me to do shoot myself as he made the look of a gun with his hand and pointed it to his head. Finally we received hair in numerous of our plates.and they blamed us for that too. This use to be a favorite of ours but Is now the stayaway location. The celebration of the life of my grandmother turned out to be the worse! They took our money to be treated like this is just as being robbed!
Do not go back to this restaurant as it is now so discusting
Food was really great.atmosphere was great as well. My 2 margaritas costed more than my food but it was still DELICIOUS

I have been looking forward to a Cubano from Florida Cafe for months, and I am sad to say I was so disappointed. 

We ordered 3 Cubanos and my dad got some other pork sandwich. All of the sandwiches were very dry. The Cubanos barely had a small squirt of mustard one very tiny spear of pickle. The meat was deli style slices. The sandwich was also luke warm, so the cheese was stiff and not very pleasing. 

The staff were friendly, but forgot our appetizer completely. 

Still searching for a delicious Cubano in LV...
Closest thing to the real thing on the west coast great food

We keep coming back!  The food is fantastic and we have never had a problem with the service.  Actually, the service was phenomenal!  Drinks were refilled before they were close to empty.

We both ordered the Pernil de Cerdo Asado with a side of Platanos Maduros.  Just writing about it has be drooling!  YUM

Yes, it is inside the Howard Johnson.  Yes, the parking situation isn't the best.  And, yes, it is on the strip - but not really - way past the end.  However, for all those faults it still warrants 5 stars.  The food and service were that good.  

We can not wait to go back!

Found this place last night food was great. Service was amazing and she explained all the Cuban drinks and sandwiches. Didn't expect the live singer but he sound good. Will defenantly be back to try more Cuban food.

The service here is always very slow.  They never provide enough amount of plates and utensils for people that is seated.  We arrived there at 11:30 am and discovered that they don't serve breakfast food after 11 am.  Hellooooo!  It's a hotel restaurant!!!  They brought my espresso before the food and by the time the food arrived I was done with my coffee.
The food here is fantastic!! A hidden gem in Las Vegas. Everyone should eat here, and have a mojito while you're at it! If you're tired of the "usual", eat some Cuban food, DELICIOUS!

The breakfast was impressive. I would recommend El Cubano. The service was amazing, and one reason I am writing the review. I had little coffee left, she kindly came and refilled. The place left a great impression on us, thank you!

I came here because I was missing my hometown of Hialeah. I started off with croquetas because I swear I had a dream with them the night before. I ate them sooooo fast. I definitely recommend them. I got 3 cups of Cuban coffee to try to kill my withdrawals. For being outside of Miami, it was heaven in a little bascito. Then we got to the entree. The ropa veja was generally good but, as comfort food usually goes, not the way abuelita made it. The biggest problem I had with my meal was the rice and beans. If you are Cuban you know, the rice and beans are sacred. I was disappointed that the rice was hard and the beans were missing. It was basically just the black bean sauce. Very disappointing. I grabbed some pastilitos and left. It wasn't a horrible experience because I'm trapped in vegas. It still brought me home.

I've been to Florida's Cafe Cuban 3 times over the past several years.  The food is very good and authentic.

Why do I say it is authentic?  My husband was born in Cuba, his grandmother and sisters are excellent cooks.  While we haven't had everything on the menu, what we have had was delicious.  i loved the bread, so crispy and light.

My finicky Uncle scraped his plate clean.  My mom, who is a picky eater, was quiet throughout her meal.

I really enjoyed the picadillo empanadas.  Very tasty, the pastry crust was light and flaky.  We had the arroz con pollo and it was very well seasoned and was way, way better than what we make at home.  

We also split the pan con lechon.  The sandwich was so good.  For American palates, the meat is a little dry, but you could ask for a bit more mojo for the sandwich, I suppose.  

The yucca was well seasoned, cooked to a soft consistency and served with onions and chicharones as well.  

There was no food left over, but my mom, aunt and uncle are up there in years and don't eat that much.  

We didn't get dessert at the restaurant, but did buy some at the bakery to take home.  Flan is really good and is not heavy.

I would highly recommend including Florida Cuban Cafe in your meal planning.

I must add that the service was exceptional.  Dealing with 3 hard of hearing older people who eat very slowly and don't always understand what is going on around them can be difficult for the waitstaff.  They never blinked an eye, and were polite and understanding.
Great authentic Cuban cuisine. Great portions and a great Strawberry Mojito. Explore off the strip and find great cuisine like this - direct from Cuba.

Don't let the location stop you from coming. 
The Florida Cafe is located in the Shalimar Hotel on Las Vegas Blvd. 
It is not a very glamorous outside, but a really nice atmosphere once inside.
It is a restaurant, bar, lounge, and bakery. It is also some amazing Cuban food!!!

The Milanese de Palomilla (breaded sirloin steak) in soooooooo good. It reminds me of my grandma's!!!!
My husband's favorite is the Rabo Encendido (oxtail stew).
Some other fabulous mentions are any and all of the beans!!!! Pinto or Black Beans you can't go wrong, and the Sandwich Cubano Especial (Traditional Cuban pressed sandwich)
You absolutely MUST get some Pastelito de Carne from the bakery on your way out!!!!
Those little meat pies are freaking addicting!!!!!!

I had not been here in a while and decided to order 20 minutes before to eat in, no issues there. The staff was friendly and I had my food served in 5 minutes. This is now the best Cuban food in town, aside from my mothers of course. The palomilla steak, delish, arroz con pollo, good, platanos maduros, yumm and yucca con mojo and chicharron, oh yeah! Oh, and the black beans were just perfect. Our waitress, Elizabeth was so nice, she brought out the lady cook (Ivey?) and we gave her kudos! I met the owner too, cool guy.

My friend brought me here, because it's one of his favorite places. Meh. It was ok. Nothing to write home about. 

I did love the bread they put in the table. It was buttered and fresh. 

I ordered the appetizer sampler so I could taste a few things. It had some potato croquette things that had smoked ham inside. They were good. The tamale was decent with chicken in it. A small Cuban sandwich which was uneventful and a potato meat thing that was good. I liked all of it, but loved none of it.

He ordered the fries plantains and I tasted them. They were pretty good too. 

I would come back again if invited, but not make a point to come on my own or suggest to friends.

First of all we went to this place thinking it was a different restaurant that my husband had scheduled reservations for, we had 33 in our party we ended up here at the Florida café and thankfully they accommodate all of my party with little wait.  they were short on staff food did take a while, but then again everything was freshly made not to mention that the cakes  were very moist and delicious. I would recommend this restaurants! Staff was wonderful
The most delicious Cuban food ever!!! The tostones rellenos appetizers were to die for and the service was excellent. A little pricey but hey, well worth it!
I used to love this place, but lately the service has gotten pretty bad. The wait time just to order is like 20 minutes. And the place is usually empty so it doesn't make any sense!

I give this place 4 stars for the food and two stars for location, maybe even one!  You can get a taxi to get there, but it's almost a miracle to get one to come back and get you.  The food is great.  Authentic cuban food.  I have been here 3 times and each time the food was wonderful.  Everyone in our group, no matter what they ordered, was happy with their food.  It may be the only great deal in Vegas.

Worse service ever! They argue with you! Rude as hell! Forgot some orders and said no it wasn't ordered. Food wasn't cooked, some were missing some ingredients that was stated it had in the menu. Just very disappointed after waiting 2 hours total! I tried to put no stars but I have to put something!!

very disappointed, the food wasn't as good as I read in the reviews, the service was slow and the worst part is I had my family (including 2 little girls)
the tables are adjacent to bar and there were 2 drunk girls making out and bothering the clients and the manager did nothing to stop it. worst experience ever. This is good for people that do not know cuban food and won't know the difference between good and mediocre cuban food.
Really enjoyed this restaurant   Food was great, like home made. Cuban coffee was very good  atmosphere very good. Reasonable price.

Service is Awsome, Vibe is wonderful and food is delicious!.. Aqui me trataron como reina :) Gracias a Sergio... He is a wonderful Person...

I leave here satisfied :)

Came today for lunch was super delish! Had the Cuban sandwitch, yucca y chicharron and tostones..all were very good. Hubby had the lechon sandwitch was very tender and super juicy. Will come back with the family. Think this is best Cuban food in Vegas..Thanks to my Daughter for recommending this place.

On entering, I asked the bartender if we could use our restaurant.com certificate for mojitos and was told no though we were allowed to in the past.  Not a problem, I pocketed the certificate and ordered a pair of mojitos.  These drinks suffered from too little mint and an overabundance of club soda.

Review based on breakfast on a weekday. Normally I don't like to leave reviews for places I visit for the first time however we will not be coming back.

Parking: 
easy since its located in a hotel

Decor/layout:
Its a bar with a restaurant seating area. Kinda divey but maybe thats the vibe they want to give off?


Food:
I ordered the "el americano" and wow was I shocked. Eggs cooked good - over easy. Toast - dry no butter and cold. Ham 2 pieces - deli sliced like something you buy at your local meat market, thinly sliced. Hashbrowns - deep fried patty, like what you get at a fast food joint. Say what!? And cold. 
Husband ordered the Cuban sandwich (recommended by our server) that same thinly sliced deli ham with cheese and avocado on a small roll. With fries - decent but cold. I tried his sandwich and it was good but small portion. 

Service:
Excellent

We were the only ones in the restaurant and they couldn't get the food right? Maybe for dinner it is better.. I really don't get it. It was overpriced and not very good. Big disappointment.

If you are cuban or you like cuban food/culture you really should go to Florida Cafe, this place is awesome, I were there last night with my wife and we both get "vaca frita" with rice and beans cooked in a unique cuban style that is called "Moros y cristianos"... The service was really good, and I don't have any complaint about it, it is a restaurant that u should check out, and I know you will like it
This is the BEST place ever! The food is delicious. The meat is soft and tender, it melts in your mouth. The rice is warm the beans are tasty. Great place to make fun memories! Love the owner!
I don't like the beef there.  You can order anything else.  The bananas are good and the Tres Leche cake is awesome
Terrible. Took us 45 min to get drinks, longer for appetizers. We had to leave before we could even order food.

I love this place and it has had a special place in my heart for a very long time. I first came here when I lived in Vegas back in 06 after going to Miami and having some awesome Cuban food and coming home craving more. I would go to Florida Cafe once a week until I moved back to Portland in 08. Every time I visit Vegas I have to go back, and I bring everyone who is with me lol. My fave is the pollo a la plancha with black beans.  I hate a yummy skirt steak dish though this time at the recommendation of my waitress.... and oh how good it was. My BF and his brother ordered my usual and we're blown away at how fresh and yummy it was(it was the first time for them). My girlfriend ordered her usual Cuban sandwich and was happy as always.  I also ordered the side of sweet fried plantains and a coconut water.  Every thing was devoured, no take home boxes needed and all for $57! Oh yeah the complimentary bread you get before your meal is crazy good too. Man I want to fly back today just to eat at this yummy little gem. Don't be scared away by the fact that it is in the lobby of the Ho Jo hotel just try it. And if your feeling a little crazy you can go across the lobby to the little white chapel chapels to tie the knot! Lol
Horrible !  Chicken had no flavor , customer service is horrible , steak flank was pure butter and onion and half way cooked ! Just stay away !

This restaurant is amazing! The meats they use are good quality and delicious I have had Ropa Vieja and the taste was exhilarating.

The service was excellent, you have to park in the back of the hotel, the place is small but they do accommodate people quickly. 

Only thing I didn't like is they don't serve those amazing fruit juices smoothie type. I really love those if they add that to their menu this place would get 5 stars for sure.

I recommend it and definitely would go back I do remember my experience being great so if you are thinking on Cuban food this is the spot, your money is worth to spend here.
Food is great! Everyone is very friendly restaurant is in a run down area but the restaurant is self is good best part is delicious food!

This is some of the best Cuban food west of the Mississippi River. I grew up in south Florida so I know what Cuban food is supposed to be. The place is a little hard to find, its built into a cheap hotel.Get the Cuban coffee and the pastelitos (how ever you spell it). My favorite thing is the 2 egg breakfast. I don't know how they make the eggs but they are really good. They also come with 2 croquettes. Every time I go to Vegas, I always stop by this place.
