Best part is they all speak spanish to me and I love how I can respond back and order in something other than English.

I was not impressed by Florida Cafe.  Many of the reviews I have read from Yelp and other review sites said it was the best cuban restaurant in Las Vegas, but I highly disagree.  My roommate and I came in for lunch on Sunday, and were a bit confused by the location, which is located inside of a Howard Johnson a little north of the strip.  Location is not a big deal to me, though, so I didn't think much of it.  

We ate in the cafe section, because the other section was closed off for a buffet, but we wanted to judge the restaurant on their everyday menu, and not a special weekend buffet.  The service was very average, and didn't put our order in until about 20 minutes after being seated.  But service isn't a big deal to me, as long as the food pulls through.  

We ordered an order of Croquetas, and an Empanada.  The croquetas were the worst I have ever had.  Very small, and lacking in flavor.  The outside was a little bit crispy, and the inside was dry and flavorless.  The empanada was pretty good, but nothing too special.  For our entrees, I ordered the Roasted Leg of Pork (pierna de puerco), which is a staple at any cuban restaurant.  My roommate ordered the steak sandwich.  Neither of us were very pleased.  The sandwich was okay, but didn't have much going on.  The leg of pork was tender, but overly oily, and did not have much of the bitter orange and garlic flavor that Pierna de Puerco usually has.  

Overall, we were very disappointed, and will probably not come back because there is a better cuban place closer to me.

Last went here over a decade ago before their big remodel and fortunately for them, they remodeled their food as well...it's finally on par with the few other great Cuban restaurants Vegas. We protested eating there for years because our last experience was so bad and food so horrible...it scarred us for a long time. Anyway, eat here in March, 2017 and this place is great! I had the bistec de palomilla, which was flavorful and not overly salty. There are only 2 little complaints: 1. They don't get all crazy with the mojo recipe like Cuba Cafe on East Trop does...it's a simpler recipe of just a few ingredients. 2. If you ask for all white rice and no beans, you still only get one serving of rice, just no beans. Tip: Save room for the bakery next door...it's no Porto's, but is still nicely done!

My Boyfriend Loves this place and we are never disappointed when eating here. Every dish is so good. 

Especially the beans and the Coffee. The desserts are always really good as well.

The location is kind of shady but the food is great.  I often get the pierna de puerco asada @ 12.95 I hardly think that the prices are unreasonable.  The chef-owner is Cuban and moved to Las Vegas from Cuba in 1992.   This food is authentic and it is delicious.

I took a 3 day trip to Las Vegas just to relax and break away from work.and spend time with my friend. I found this little Cuban bar & Grill. This place is amazing the food was wonderful . I grew up on cuban food. This is the first place that I've found that the food is great and tasty. So every time I go the Las Vegas I will be visiting them 1st thing.  The service was great very friendly. Thanks again florida cafe
drove all the way from my little city to this spot just for the food.. talk about crazy good an worth it..

I've been here years ago, but for some reason haven't been back. 

A few friends suggested coming here as they haven't been in a long time as well and a few in our party never been. 

We shared appetizers of - 

Jamon Croquettas - so think of if ham were fish sticks, then that would be this. Interesting, but I wouldn't get it again. 

Chicarones - these were served warm and were nicely crunchy. Solid chicaron. 

And they serve you white bread rolls slathered in butter. 

The BF and I shared - 

Cuban Sandwich with fries - This was a decent sandwich, but not the best I've had. Get it with the plaintain chips if you're into them as someone in our party got those and I thought that was better as the fries are standard. 

Pernil de Cerdo Asado - the pork was pretty tender and the red beans were pretty good. I feel it was missing something like a sauce though. I order something similar in LA and it's in a mojo sauce and I could have sworn eons ago when I was here last my meat was more citrusy. 

Service was just OK. Sometimes it seemed like they didn't really care and seemed to mishear us a lot. "Okay, french fries" "No, chicarones." "Oh okay". "Chuletas de Cerdo" "No, Pernil de Cerdo" "Oh'. Someone got black beans instead of what they actually ordered. 

It's a unique place with some charm. I feel it was slightly better years ago when we used to go. I remember really loving the pork back then, but I didn't feel the love as much now. I would probably eat here again when there is a hankering, but it sits right in the middle of the road for me.
We've been coming here since 2004 and I will say there food is very fresh and the environment is very pleasant
Having been born in Cuba, and grew up in the beautiful USA. I have eaten many a Cuban meal. And this place hits the spot if your looking for some Cuban Cuisine

NEVER COME HERE! Terrible food terrible drinks terrible service! If I could give this place a negative 1 star I would. Two drink and one plate cost 70 bucks waste of time and money just save your self the disappointment and never come here

Really like this place. I rarely eat in, frequently get takeout when in Las Vegas. 

Note to the reviewer who wants to know how to make ropa vieja, get a copy of "The Coumbia Restaurant Cookbook", and a crockpot. You'll have what you need to do it.

Really like the food here. Its the most authentic I've found in Las Vegas. I am from Tampa, FL, my father was from Latin America, we lived in Cuba pre, during and post Castro. I grew up on this cuisine and can rattle those pots and pans with the best of them. 

I introduced my friends who live in LV to this cuisine, and they are hooked. Every time I visit, I get takeout for all of us at least once. Big favorite is the picadillo, which is outstanding.  Nice big olives, and tons of flavor. Ropa is also wonderful as is tbe chicken and yellow rice. You can tell with that dish the rice was cooked in the broth of the chicken. It wasnt made with one pot of premade yellow rice, add sauteed chicken pieces. Nope, this is made homestyle. The stuffed potatoes are excellent. They are nice and crispy, not greasy. The filling is excellent, and they use real mashed potatoes, not instant. If these are frozen, I'd be shocked. 

Cuban sandwich is authentic. Its too bad Cuban bread isn't available in LV. Fricasse de pollo is suck your fingers good. Last time I got food they were out of this dish :(

Florida Cafe seems to be comfortable staying with what they do best; serving up Cuban soul food. Last time I was in town I tried to get takeout from some of the other Cuban restaurants. Surprisingly, picadillo and ropa were not available at tbese other places. What??? Thats like going to a soul food place that doesnt have man and cheese or cornbread on the menu.

We did eat in tbe restaurant 2-3 times and that I remember, never had any issues with service. Location is a little funky,   

Go and enjoy. La comida es muy rica!

The food was not memorable.  The service was lousy.  My husband and I were seated and our order was not taken for just over a half hour. We sat there and watched as other groups/individuals were seated and had their orders taken before us.  We kept trying to get our waitresses attention and had no success for quite awhile. We should have just walked out. But we stayed, eventually ordered and had an o.k. meal.

This restaurant was a recommendation and my first try with the Cuban foods. I was dying to try the Yuca al Mojo con Chicharrón - cassava root vegetable, garlic sauce and pork skins.

Cassava root has the texture of potato or yam. Sticky. Stringy. It was possibly buttery as well and the garlic sauce permeated throughout. It added, I believe, to the flavor. 

But it was the crispy curled pork skins that offered that porky bacony hamesque pork deliciousness flavor. All together the tastes and textures, crispy mushy garlicky, merged to make a unique edible. I do not regret my decision. I will remember fondly Yuca al Mojo con Chicharrón in Las Vegas. 

Hot for Cuban food? Seek this restaurant out. You will not be disappointed and be glad you did.
I just moved to Vegas from Miami, so being from Miami I needed my cuban food and hands down this place is awesome. I go here all the time!!!!

I loooove my Cuban food! Portions are pretty big and I never leave hungry. Staff can often take a bit to come by the table and forgets your orders but I go there mostly for the food not the staff. If you've never been there before its hard to find since inside the Howard Johnson hotel and the area is a little sketchy but once you're in the restaurant it's a whole lot different. Will definitely keep going back.

This place is so cool!! A little Havana in the corner of Vegas .... Just north of were we stayed, located what use to be Howard  Johnson inn, me and my wife love to come here every time we come to Vegas.  The food is authentic and I feel like I'm in either Florida or in Cuba.  I had beef tips (I forgot what it was in the menu) and they always come with white steamed rice Nd red or black beans. 

The staff are friendly and although there can be a language barrier at times (depends on who is serving you).   This is our third time coming to this place.  They have a bakery where you can buy authentic Cuban pastries, they have also a dance floor and live music, I'm almost guessing that they open at night as a dance club. A lot of salsa / cha cha music.  I can only guess that local Cubans and or carrebean patrons come here and hang out.  If you ever come to Vegas, try something different away buffets that all those casino offer.. Lol try Cuban

Great food nice place but service needs to improve....the waitress look like have no experience at all.... a very great place with a wrong staff. Needed a Manager to improve the service guarantee. May be some day!

I'm Cuban and it breaks my heart to give this place a poor review but there's just no way around it. The food sucks, the service is slow and the ambiance is 1980 Miami (think Scar Face).  It's very tough to get Cuban food in Vegas so if you have the craving you may have to bite the bullet and try it. Keep your expectations low and you may not be too disappointed.

This is my go-to Cuban restaurant. They remember you and the staff is amazing. Better yet, the food is AMAZING! I haven't tried anything I didn't like from here. I went back again today, and I found out they no longer do the buffet, which kinda sucked. BUT they do have another deal they're starting and I highly recommend you try it! Its 3 dishes (which are HUGE) portions for 7.50/person. OMG, wonderful! I simply love this place. Oh! & don't let its location stop you from going in cuz its one of the best places around.

Dont know why people give this place high ratings!? It freaking sucks! Food sucks! Cuban sandwich is a joke! Nothing but deep fried vomit! Whoever thinks this food is good, is a peasant who wouldn't know the difference between a fine steak and a shoe sole! To say that service was bad, is an understatement. We were waiting for our two very, very simple sandwiches for an hour!!! I time it, not exaggerating! Save your time the trouble and go elsewhere, don't waste your time, oh, and before I forget, the service probably sucks because the dang waiter would stop at every opportunity to flirt with some girls sitting two booths down from mine.

i went a few months ago and was not impressed but I decided to give it a second try and am glad I did---------friendly staff---great coffee-------had the El Cubano----fried plantains were delicious----eggs were good and bread was fantastic----stuffed potatos were good but a little bland-------I will definitely go back

I love coming here for breakfast . The croqueta Platanito y huevo plate is my favorite. The food is good and the prices are great! I definitely make it a point to come here at least once why stay in Vegas. I highly recommend this place you can't go wrong everything on the menu is amazing I've had lunch here before and dinner everything is good. They also have salsa music on the weekends. The waitress Elizabeth la mexicana was very sweet and attentive

After seeing all the advertisements around town, I was determined to give Florida Cafe a try. A friend had passing the qualifying tests to become a PhD student. What a perfect opportunity for a celebratory lunch. 

Attached to the Howard Johnson on Las Vegas Boulevard, you can easily miss the parking lot if you don't read the sign quick enough. The turn into the motel leads to the parking for both establishments. The decorum is dark and most of the tables are set up for family style eating. It does not matter if you are a party of 1 or 10, you probably will be sat at the same size table. If it is busy, do not be surprise if you end up with a random stranger sitting next to you. This can be nice if you are a social person and don't mind small chat. 

There were two people serving in the entire restaurant. It was not that busy, but one guys was running around doing everything. Although service was lacking, and the food was slow, he was friendly. It took a little more than half an hour for our order to come. We thought it was just us, but everyone around us were complaining to themselves as well.

The food is nothing impressive. I know I ripped into Mi Peru, but Florida Cafe makes the former seem perfect. Still confused about the difference between most of Latin cuisine, I ordered the arroz con pollo. I am out on a quest to at least find the best version of this dish in Vegas. The rice was fluffy, but greasy and overly salty. The mixed in pieces of peas and potatoes were a nice addition. The bell peppers tasted like they were pickled, but oily at the same time. I have never came across this combination before. At this point, I missed the pickled onions that I got at Mi Peru. The dish came with a side of beans, three pieces of plantains, and two chicken drumsticks. The overall temperature of the meal was cooler than room temperature. It was not cold, but was getting there. My favorite side dish to any Cuban meal, the plantains were old and chewy instead of hot, crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside. My friend ordered a Cuban. It was also really salty and the pulled pork was dry. 

I was told that they open the buffet on the weekends and it is a better deal. I am just glad that my group is going out again tonight, because this was more of a punishment than a celebration of a job well done.

Small place, parking in a hotel complex, the service was descent I gave it a 5star because the food was very delicious and tasty! Very reasonable, We are from out of town and this is a spot that when we come to Vegas will definitely stop again!

We stopped in for lunch. Other than one couple we were the only customers. After being seated it took several minutes for our server to come over. My wife ordered the small Cuban sandwich from the appetizers along with white rice beans and pork. I ordered the small Cuban pizza. My wife got her food first, which was fine. She enjoyed the Cuban sandwich and the rice was very good. I ordered  a small Cuban Pizza. My pizza arrived after 22 minutes. For a small pizza it was easily 10 to 11 inches across. I don't know what made it a Cuban pizza. It lacked traditional spices you find on pizza. I would have asked for any spices however, our server only stopped by just prior to us leaving. Is it asking to much for a refill on drinks. For that I have to mark them down in their rating. Also, be careful and ask about parking to avoid being towed. 

It really was a 2.5 Stars
Once is enough for me.

I'm giving this restaurant two stars because I'm Cuban and I love plantain chips, but other than that everything was pretty bad. 

I must admit, we had a nice-sized party of around 17 people. I understand that this can be stressful for servers and cooks but a restaurant on Las Vegas Boulevard, connected to a hotel as well as being adjacent to a "Little White Wedding Chapel" should be prepared for something like this. 

The starters took forever to arrive which consisted of a plate of bread and some plantain chips. We were HANGRY by the time this made it to the table. The food was reasonable. I might be biased because I grew up in cuba around authentic food so I didn't find it fascinating. To make things short, our food took way too long to arrive and they got most of our orders wrong. Some of the stuff they brought out, nobody had ordered. 

For being a Saturday night, they were dead, which is also why they shouldn't have gotten so many things wrong. There's no one else to tend to! 

After dinner they charged us for a bunch of stuff that they brought out that nobody in our party ordered, so we had to analyze the bill and explain to them what we ordered and what we actually got (because keep in mind some of the stuff I actually ordered never made it to the table).  

Save yourself a headache and go to Havana Grill. The embargo is lifted, so actually, just go to Cuba instead.

I'm so glad I found this little gem! I will be at this establishment at least once a month now. The papas rellenas and ropa vieja was very good. I took one star away because they forgot to put the sauce on my husbands steak and well because, it wasn't a 5 star experience but maybe next time it will be. I still had an amazing time with all of our friends and family.

The food here is great and they have a great selection of pastries and desserts but they're service kinda sucks (maybe because there weren't many workers and we came around brunch). It took us a while to get our drinks and for someone to take our order but once we said something about the service, our server was much more attentive. 

Overall: come for the food and not for the service!
Absolutely the best Cuban food in the city. I've been to others around town but they don't even come close to this place. Hands down the best.

Super tasty and authentic Cuban food. Was set on Thai food for dinner but after my uber app took me to the wrong place, my uber driver, from Cuba, recommend this place. It was so tasty. Get the mojito and plantains for sure. I had some shredded beef dish that was marinated in wine with onions and bell peppers, yum. Even though it wasn't my intentions to go here I am sure glad I ended up here.

I found this place from my dad. He would always come here on his trips to Vegas so now my husband and I come every time we come to Vegas. It's pretty hidden out in Downtown Vegas. It's inside a Howard Johnson hotel. 

Service was excellent for us. I got chicken with onions, rice, black beans, maduros. It was delicious!! 

I think it was remodeled It looked nicer from what I remember. The restrooms were very clean. Definitely check this place out if you're in Vegas

The food here is very, very good. The Florida sandwich a la locura is a flattened chicken breast served on a giant round roll and topped with grilled onions, lettuce, tomato, cheese and mayo - even skipping the cheese and mayo it winds up being good for two or three meals. 

The arroz con pollo is delicious and I'm wishing i had some right now - the chicken is flavorful and the yellow rice with pimentos and peppers is incredibly flavorful, made all the more so by the fact that there's a bit of crisp to the rice like at the bottom of a paella.

Appetizers worth seeking out include the tostones with ropa vieja and the chorizo frito. As for the sopa de frijoles negros, I have cravings about this ridiculously good soup, topped with pungent slivers of white onion. I recommend liberally spiking this hearty soup with the green habanero hot sauce on the tables.

So then why am I only giving Florida Cafe three stars? Because it may have the most consistently poor service of any restaurant I frequent in Las Vegas. Slow, unaccommodating, absentee service is frustrating when the food is this good. Even when I'm the only customer in the restaurant I can't get any attention.

Sunday early evening, a marinated steak, great appetizer with 2013 Robert Mondavi Private Selection Cabernet Sauvignon. We had an amazing dinner in a great atmosphere. We got a guava cheese pastry on the way out which completed our wonderful meal.
Me encanta el ambiente cubano, la música, todos me atendieron súper bien y la comida ni se diga riquísimo como entrar en Cuba en medio de las Vegas!!

Am dying to try this place after reading the reviews. I'm 3rd-gen Cuban & also curious---has anyone checked out the live music here? Is it authentic Cuban music, and if so, when does it happen? Thanks!

Came here after an appointment with our lawyer downtown, and my husband and I really loved it.  Mind you, the only thing I have to compare this to is a few meals at Porto's when I lived in the Los Angeles area, and a meal 10 years ago in Fort Lauderdale that I barely remember.  So we aren't exactly experts on Cuban food.

We ordered the croquetas, which were a fried ham stuffing thingy that was very good.  The bread was grilled with butter and was heavy but very tasty.  I had the camarones al ajillo, which is just shrimp cooked in olive oil, garlic, and white wine.  It was very good but they overcooked the shrimp a little.  My husband had the boliche mechado, which was a braised beef stuffed with chorizo.  He really loved it, thought the flavors were outrageous.  I thought it was pretty heavy for lunch, but we had a restaurant.com certificate and needed to spend $35.

Although the neighborhood is god-awful, and we might not go out of our way to go here, we'll definitely come back here, or try their sister restaurant that is closer to our house.

Florida Cafe was another restaurant where we bought a coupon for $25 off from restaurant.com.  Cuban eateries aren't very common around here (I would have to go into Boston for Cuban food), so I was all over coming here. This is definitely located in the seedier side of Vegas. When we heard that it was three miles from the Bally's hotel, we decided to wait until the day we rented the car to come here...and I'm really glad we didn't walk.  Actually, I thought the inside was pretty cute-- there were palm trees painted on the walls and the bar had bongos for stools.  

Our waitress wasn't the most friendly person and another waitress kept bringing us drinks and food and sounded like she was apologizing for the slowness of the first waitress, but I couldn't really tell.  For drinks, the husband had a gin and tonic and I had a mango mojito (which took a long time to make).  The tostones (fried plantains) and shrimp  sounded good for appetizer, so we ordered that.  There were six plantain patties and we simply couldn't finish the app.  My husband had his standard ropa vieja for dinner with rice and beans and I had the arroz con pollo.  My dish, although savory, had sweet plantains on top of the rice, which was a little strange and didn't fit very well, but since I love plantains, I didn't mind too much.  The portions were very large and I could only finish about a third of my dish.  In addition, the arroz con pollo came with a black bean soup.  

If I came back to Vegas, I'm not sure if I would come back, mostly because of the isolated location.  Also, I thought the wait staff were not very customer service oriented.  However, I'm glad I was able to eat Cuban food during our trip.

I like to venture out w diff. types of food once in awhile so I wanted to give this place a try with a Groupon offer. Total disappointment. First of all, its location...sucks! Secondly, unprofessional staffs busy eating and talking...sucks! And lastly, very-dried-up-NO-flavor-over-fried food...major sucks!

Food was amazing.   The parking is horrible and not near the best parts of town but I am so glad we took the chance and ate here.   Love the music, the waitresses, and the decor.  A must for authentic Cuban Food.

Who would have thought you could find good cuban food in a Howard Johnsons?  Throw in an excellent bakery and you have a winner.  The prices for lunch are reasonable, if slightly higher than I would like and the portions are large.  The cuban sandwich is good and I enjoyed the croquetas de Jamon and the Cuban Tamale. I am putting this place into my lunch rotation.
Excellent food, excellent drinks, and an excellent wait staff. Parking is a tricky but well worth it.

HMMmmm.  This was a tough one, but I guess that's why we are here.  I seem to enjoy the food but I was far from impressed.  I will go pros and cons.  

Pros;

It is a unique place.  It has it has a charm to it.  It's different.

The food was tasty.  I had roasted pork with red beans and rice.  It did seem to be missing something like a sauce or something.  It was meat - rice - beans... I was wondering if Cuban food comes with some type of condiment or something...

One major plus was the Mojito!!

Cons;

It was not very busy but they had the few guests jammed into 3 booths in a corner of the restaurant.  I am sure this is for a server convenience thing but I would have like to spread out a bit.  Also,  The booth was missing half the padding in the back and it was just covered over.  

The appetizer was a fried potato thing.  It was 2 golf ball size fried mashed potato balls with a little meat.  Not exactly generous.  Maybe if they had some cavier on it or something.

This place is in a terrible location.  I was confused as hell.  The parking is in the back of the Howard Johnson.  Then you walk through the hotel.  It was weird.  Luckily my friend knew how to get into this place.

Service was ho-hum.

The manager approached us and asked, Did you find a cell phone here."  I am okay with helping someone recover lost property.  I would have preferred if the manager said, "exceuse me for interupting your dinner, but someone lost a cell phone do you mind if we look real quick."  I guess it isn't a big deal but it rubbed my rhubarb the wrong way.

The prices seem to be pricey too.

First off parking sucks. Restaurant wasn't too busy.  Portions are good, food is decent, service leaves a lot to be desired. Food was ready pretty quick so don't bother ordering an appetizer (ours came with the rest of dinner). We stated that we would be sharing all of our entrees with our five year old and no plate or bowl was offered or brought for him. They placed our food and practically ran away. When someone finally realized we needed something and we were able to ask for a bowl we were almost done and it still took quite some time for them to finally bring a bowl (our son had been eating off of the appetizer plate). We finished up and asked for to go boxes and the check. Got the boxes and the check no problem. But had to chase someone down with all of us packed and ready to go so that we could get out credit card back. Food was tasty but probably won't go back.

This place was such a disappointment:( The service was terrible. We were not offered refills once during our time during dining. The food was lack luster. The Cuban sandwich had pork on it that looked like rubber...would not recommend this place to anyone looking for excellent Cuban food made the way it should be.

I can't believe all of the poor reviews on here. The food is wonderful!  I was slightly apprehensive due to the location, but the entire experience and meal from start to finish was perfect. The greeting at the door, appetizers, main course, dessert, coffee, service, accommodating my picky husband....everything.

Visiting from Hawaii.

Nothing super fancy, but the food was better than anticipated (based in previous reviews) and the service was very attentive. 

We ordered the variety appetizer, which was amazing! It arrived with two ham/pork and cheese type sandwiches, fried bananas, sirloin steak, skirt steak and Moros y cristianos. My husband and I enjoyed all the flavors though we had to do take-out because we were so stuffed. 

We would definitely return to this restaurant.

Let me begin by saying that the Shalimar Hotel has taken over from the Howard Johnsons, so don't look for HoJo anymore. Now, on to the food. If you like authentic Cuban food, then this is the best you will find in Las Vegas! I would put the flavors on track with the best Cuban restaurants in Miami (think Versaille). Yes it's in a "shady" part of Vegas Blvd surrounded by signs for seedy topless bars and wedding chapels but the food makes it worth the trip. My suggestion is to go for lunch or early dinner, then head to Downtown for some fun and games. Yes the servers do not speak english very well, but that makes it part of the fun! Our server Elizabeth was from Havana and was friendly and professional. When she found out this was the first time eating there for some of the people in our group she said, "everything the best for you!" Now we did have spanish speakers in our group and I have eaten a lot of Cuban food in the past, so you can believe me when I say this food is on point. Go, park in the back, order some ropa vieja (spanish for "old clothes" but it's shredded beef in a tomato based sauce with onions and bell peppers). I had the arroz con pollo (rice and chicken) and it's fantastic. Attractively served, well seasoned and tastes like my grandpa used to make! If you're stuck up or too good to eat at a small restaurant that serves authentic food, then it's your loss. Don't be stuck up and miss out!

Best Cuban food outside of Miami!!!!! 

The original Cuban sandwich with banana chips and an oil and garlic sauce is AMAZING!!!  I could eat at this place once a week and never get bored.

3 stars because their potatoes balls stuffed with ground beef were delicious.  Otherwise...

...Florida Cafe turned out to be a huge letdown for me.  For years, I've wanted to try this place that I keep hearing about from people, seeing ads for on bus stops...

So one night after CES, we made last minute reservations to go.  They weren't busy...I mean, seriously, who goes to a HoJo (Howard Johnson) for dinner?  (Apparently, they're also big on weddings - saw a wedding party and huge limo milling around the parking area.)

As I said, our starter, the potato balls were great.  That got us even more excited for our actual food.  We shared the following:

FC's "Famous" black bean soup - Served not quite hot, which was strike #1...and basically it was just...beans.  A big ole bowl of black beans cooked for a long time.  They weren't great, flavorful or anything. It congealed as it cooled and after about 10 minutes, was no longer in the realm of appetizing.

Cuban Sandwich - Unlike the soup, this dish was served lava-hot.  Even 20 minutes after it was served to us, we still burnt our tongues on the cheese.  Though not as disappointing as the soup, the sandwich was still underwhelming.  There was no real flavor that stood out.  The "pickled" veggies that they put in the sandwich weren't nearly noticeable.

Beans & Rice - Ok...really?  Cubans make their rice with Uncle Ben's boil in a bag dealio?  Really.  The description of the dish mentioned black beans mixed in with pork bits.  Delicious right?  Wrong.  I got myself a big plate of terribleness.  It smelled like instant rice and tasted like it.  I like how the rice comes served molded in a bowl which they lift away as they present it to you. My, how that Uncle Ben's rice scattered as soon as the bowl was taken away.  What's the point of molding it?

Service was decent and for that and the potato balls, I'm giving FC 3 stars thought I quite believe I'm being very generous.

Where to start.  I come from Miami Florida.  I haven't been for a whole and miss Cuban food.  I heard about this place from an Uber Driver who is Cuban himself and decided to try it.

Boy do I regret it.  I will say the place is clean. And good atmosphere and service decent. The little things.  Ask for desperate checks before we ordered.  In English and in Spanish.  I saw waitress desperate when wrote order down yet brought check and all was mixed.  She said oh yeah I forgot.  Yeah small I know.

Food ordered a tamale it tasted weird and was gooey not what a Cuban tamale should be like.  Again I'm use to places in Miami.  Rice and beans in one plate with plantains or yuca.  And then mail protein on another plate.  Well was disappointed here.  I ordered Ropa Vieja (shredded beef) rice and beans and small bowl with beef on same plate.  The beef bowl would be considered a cup of soup in most places. A side of yuca was bigger.  Now as I said in Miami all would be a meal and just looked it up in nice classy Miami Cuban restaurant 10.50 for ropa Vieja and 2.50 for soda.

This place?  Ropa Vieja 14.00 side yuca 5.00 soda 3.00 $22 plus tax plus tip.  So cost way more for way less.

All that equals thanks but never again.... Sad and the search continues for decent Cuban food

I'm not sure why this place has some terrible reviews.  Although I considered not coming because of some of the bad reviews, but we decided to try it anyway.  
The place was really clean and the staff was pretty much on top of things. We came on a Saturday at noon.  
The food: we have had some authentic Cuban down in Tampa. So I have some good Cuban to compare the food to.  My husband and I got different dishes and an appetizer. The appetizer was the Papa rellenas con aioli !! Omg this was really good and flavorful.  My meal was ropa vieja and his was arroz con polla.  We tried each others and they both were really good. Great portions!!
Best food I have ever tried!! Will definitely try again when I come back to vegas. Customer service  and food is excellent! AAA+

Went for dinner tonight. I read reviews of poor service or marginal food, but we did not experience any of that. We had the BEST waitress, helpful and sweet. The place was very clean and the staff was friendly. Food was good and everything fresh.  We will go back again.

I dont know what happened to this place!! I have been coming here since 2007 and let me tell you, 4 years ago this place was easily a 5 star!!! I went back a few weeks ago to have lunch after almost 2 years and i'll say that the customer service really went downhill. The waitress was so nonchalant and indifferent towards us it aggravated the hell out of me!! Back in the day, they served cuban bread  to your table before your meal was ever served! I asked the waitress twice for an order of Cuban bread! The first time she said the chef in the back was preparing it.. 15 minutes came by and after our main course was already on the table, still no cuban bread. We were finally done eating and ready to go when the cuban bread finally came to the table!! We had to have it boxed to go.. I will give 3 stars because the food is really good, but they seriously need to get it together or they're gonna loose this loyal customer...

First off, dont be creaped out that its in the hojo! This place is a hidden gem! First-the bar has bongo seats for chairs. And the service is good every time. The staff is very solid. Been here a half dozen times now and they are truly nice. The price point is epic-$5 breakfasts before 11 am! If your partying on the strip or downtown and dont want to overpay for breakfast-grow a pair-and head to the florida cafe. You will not regret it.
LOVE LOVE LOVE The Cuban sandwhich! Atmosphere is authentic and the staff is friendly and very attentive. I keep going back because the sandwhich keeps getting better each time!

We decided to eat at The Florida Cafe because it was in our hotel. It took a while for us to get seated. The waitresses seemed off in their own world most of the time. We waited about 20 minutes before we even got our servers attention that we wanted to order. I thought the food was okay, but my husband loved what he got. When we needed refills, our waitress was nowhere to be found.

This place would probably make so much more money if they actually were more attentive. I mean, it's seriously bad it's almost comical. They ignore you, serve the wrong food, act surly and you pretty much have to keep going up to the bar to ask for: plates, ketchup, utensils, the check etc. The food is however good. Would be a lot better if some of the items were cooked to a higher temperature, but I digress. There's a good looking bakery next door  but sadly no one to sell us any of the items. So, if they were a little more up in their service, they'd most likely be up in the revenue too.

Today was the first time I tried this cafe/restaurant and I ordered a Cuban sandwich. DISAPPOINTING!!!!!! First of all I ordered it in the bakery where the price was $7, I get charged $10 because it came with greasy wilted fries that came in a little paper sack and were not cooked all the way. And it took forever with nobody in there. The sandwich was so basic I could have done it at home. I was really hoping for it to be A LOT better but not so much. I am a local and wanted to love this place. The music was good and the service was decent.

Poor experience. Food was bland and customer service was just as bad. 6 staff/waitresses and only 2 guests (besides us) and somehow they were too busy to acknowledge us or even refill our glass of waters. We asked for water and After 15 min more customers arrived and realized they were offered bread and other fruit on their water(lemon,lime etc) yet nothing to us not even a glance at us. Ordered a Cuban sandwich. I regret it now. I could have made this easily made this at home. I swear it was like sandwich meat you would get at the grocery store. After finishing the food it took the 6 non busy waitresses to stop gossiping or stop paying attention to the other 3 guests to actually look at our direction so I can ask them for the check. Would not come here again

Well where can I start. Over the past few years I've occasionally dropped in to eat here in hopes that they would improve. Sometimes the foods great and the service sucks or vice versa. I can never seem to get both at the same time. The past couple of times I've eaten here I've found that the food was bland. The maduros tasted like it was fried earlier that day then microwaved when ordered. The beans were lukewarm along with the dish. It seems like they cooked all the food earlier and reheated it when I ordered it. The Sangria was the only thing that was decent. The service was good AFTER the waitress decided to come to our table to help us which took a while.  The Yuca con Mojo used to be really good here but the other day it was dry and tasteless. The only reason why I keep trying this place out is because there are very few choices in town. Not going anymore after this.

I love Cuban food. My boyfriend took me to this place on our second date. Hidden gem. I love the plantains, plantain chips, ceviche, cuban sandwich, etc.  Today we had more of a lunch date there. Since out second date we have been here a few times.. :) Seemed busier than normal, and service was just okay. I asked for plantain chips instead of fries...I was brought out fries. I didn't complain about it because fries were good, and our waitress seemed like she was rushing around taking care of other stuff.

Oh my gosh we walk in & no service around . Waiting & waited..
Finally someone walk us with menus to The middle of the room and there was great entertainment BUT after no service .we waited a half an hour just to get one drink and to get a glass of water..awful service for some of us unfortunately. No one gave us eye contact & no one approached us and acknowledged us . It's like we were invisible. The worst part about it was a big party of 10 came in after us and they were served right away! food and drinks and all! so that pretty much told us everything we wanted to about Florida Café.. I cannot rate the food because we were never served after waiting an hour and a half we walked out of there.

I don't know why I am here. O yeah, I'm meeting with my brother and my sister-in-law after the show. Since I already have my big meal before the show, I promised to meet up with my family at this place. Somehow I noticed there's not much people here but yet the service is very bad. This is my first time to check this place out. It would have been nice to try their food if I wasn't full. However, I managed to order a cup of cappuccino and dessert. It took them too long to come to the table to get my order. Then I was waiting for my dessert to come around and it never did until we literally have to flag down one of the waiters. I'm not happy with the customer service. Although, I like the Cuban, Latin music being played. Hopefully next time around I can check out their dance floor. I heard that there's live music or the dance floor is open certain nights of the week. If that's true, then maybe I'll check it out. For now, I hope they'll make some improvements in how to serve their customers better and faster.

Parking may be a bit inconvenient, but you forget about that as soon as you walk in. Beautiful interior, decorations, and paintings. Salsa music playing overhead gives it an extra warm feel. Waiters and waitresses are friendly, but not too over-bearing and annoying. Great authentic selection of food whether it be seafood, pork, chicken, beef for reasonable prices. Dessert menu, marvelous! Family friendly. Back room turns into a lounge/nightclub at night on the weekends for live music, DJ's and dancing. Great place to go to! Definitely deserves all 5 stars.

I've only been here once and it wasn't busy so service was not a problem when I went. The food was soooo good! We had the pernil which was moist and delicious, tostones, maduras, chicken, moros y cristianos. Omg everything was awesome! I will definitely go back!

If your looking for some Cuban food, I would recommend Florida Cafe. It's not in the best area, but Cuban hospitality is at it's finest. We ordered bistec de milanesa (breaded Milanese steak) with congri (black beans and rice cooked together), tostones (twice fried plantains), avocado salad, papa rellanas(potato balls filled with picadillo), churrasco con cimi churri (grilled skirt steak) with white rice and black beans, mojitos, Cuban coffee and of course flan. The food was good with plenty of flavor. Cuban food is always better when home made, but the atmosphere made up for it. A must try if you've never had Cuban food.

My boyfriend love this place while I didn't have a very good experience there. The food was ok, nothing special maybe because I am not a fan of Cuban food. But what shocked me is that some of the employees don't speak English. When I am in America and go to restaurants yes, I demand that the stuff speaks English and understands me. 
We took there our friend from outside the State and when the server lady brought us our dishes, I grabbed my friend's one by mistake. And the server lady slapped me slightly in my hands as if I was a little kid and was reaching for a piece of candy before dinner , just because she didn't speak English and couldn't explain to me that it wasn't mine. I was embarrassed in front of my boyfriend and my friend. 
Three star because their bakery is good.

This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!!! I could eat here every day for the rest of my life and be in heaven!!! :-) We had a family gathering here of like 20 people and the staff was VERY accomodating, courteous, and efficient. I love the ambiance...very tropical. The food is delicious. I love the Masas de Puerco, the Picadillo, the Black Beans, and the Tostones. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!!!

Sometimes the best places are nestled into places you would not expect.  Like this gem downtown that is housed in the confines of the HoJo on Las Vegas Blvd.  The parking is in the back lot which at later hours can feel not so safe so I would probably have at least one other friend with me.  The restaurant features great cuban fare like Arroz con Pollo, plantains, and some of the best chicharon.  They have also added a Buffet feature which is great for the time pressed individuals and those with large parties.  The food is equally as good with no impact to quality having gone buffet style.  There is reasons why it earned such praise.
